üìï

HTML & CSS Design And Build Website

How People Access The Web

Before we looking at the code that used to build the website it‚Äôs important to consider different things. Which is how people access the web and clarify some terminology

BROWSERS

  • People accessing the website using the software called Web Browsers. Example these are the popular software that can access the website , Internet Explorer , Chrome , Fire Fox , Microsoft Edge.
  • In order to access the web page users might use the web address in the web browsers , following the links from another site or use the book mark.
  • Software manufacturers regularly release a new version of the browser with a new features

    and supporting new addition to the language it‚Äôs important. However to remember that

    some computer owner will not running on the latest version of the browsers therefore we

    cant reply on the visitor to the site to be able to use the latest functionality offer by the browser.

WEB SERVERS

  • When you ask the browser about the web page. The request are sent over the internet to the special computer known as Web Servers. This web servers is the one that host the website.
  • Web Server is a special kind of computer that constantly connect to the internet and are optimized to sent the web page out to the people that request them
  • Some big company use their own Web Servers. But most commonly use the Service of a Web Hosted company who charge a fee to host your site.

DEVICES

  • People are accessing the website on increasing range of device including the desktop computer , laptop , tablet and mobile phone. It‚Äôs important to remember that various of device have a different screen size and some device got a faster connection to the web than the other.

SCREEN READERS

  • Screen readers are the program that read out the content from the computer to the user. That is commonly use by the People that have a Visual impairments.
  • In the same way that many country have a legislation ( laws ) that require public building to be accessible to those who with disability. many laws have been passed that require website be accessible to those who with disability.
  • It‚Äôs interesting to note that similar technology those employ by Screen readers are also common being used in other area. Where you unable to read the screen such as driving , running ‚Ä¶.. so you can use the Screen reader to read for you while multitasking.

How Websites Are Created

All Website are use HTML and CSS but Content Management System, E-commerce platform Blogging Software often add a few more technology into mix

What You Will See

  • When you look at the website actually it turn out that the web browsers are receiving HTML and CSS from the web server that host the site. The web browser interpreted the HTML and CSS code to create the page you see.
  • Most Web page also include other content such as image , video , animation and audio.
  • Some Web page will sent JavaScript or Flask to the web browser.

How It Is Create

  • Small website are often written and just using in HTML and CSS
  • For a larger website in particularly those who update regularly use Content Management System ( CMS ) , Blogging tool or a E-commerce software often make an use of complex technology on the web server. However these technology actually produce HTML and CSS that is then sent it to the web browser. So if your website are using this technology you will be able to use that new HTML and CSS knowledge and that control over the site.
  • Much Larger Website and Complex Website may need a database to store a data and a programming language such as PHP , ASP. NET , Java , Ruby.

HTML5 & CSS3

  • Since the Website was first created there are several version of HTML and CSS. Each intent every version is the improvement from the previous version
  • At the time writing this book HTML5 & CSS3 are still developing. Although it‚Äôs not yet being finalized many browser are already support a new feature of this language also many Coder are using the latest version of technology( HTML5 & CSS3 ) on their website
  • Because HTML5 and CSS3 are build on of the previous HTML and CSS. Learning this HTML5 and CSS3 meaning that you will be able to understand the previous version of them

How The Web Works

When you look at the website the web server hosting that site could be anywhere in the world so in order that our browser know the location of the web server first it need to connect to the Domain Name System ( DNS ) server.

  1. When you connect to the web. To do so via Internet Service Provider ( ISP ) Users typically type a domain name for example : google.com , microsoft.com or a web address in to the web browser to visit the site.
  1. After that your computer will contact the Network Servers Call Domain Name System( D N S ) servers. These act like a phone book that tell the Computer the IP Address associate with the domain name or web address that we request . IP address is a number up to 12 digits separated by full stop or period. Every Device that connect to the web have their own unique IP address it just like a phone number for that computer ( Computer have a Unique phone number now) .
  1. The Unique Number ( IP Address ) that Domain Name System ( D N S ) have return to the computer allow the browser to contact that web server that host our website that we request since the step 1. Web Server is constantly connect to the web and especially set up to set the web page to the users.
  1. The Web Server then sent the request page back to the web browser.

CHAPTER ONE : STRUCTURE

We come across all kind of document in our Everyday life. News paper , Insurance form , Shop catalogues and the list go on

Many web page act like a electronic version of all that kind of document. Meaning that the News paper that tell the same story in print are also same on web page , Insurance form can also apply on web and store have online catalogues and e-commerce facilities.

In all kind of document. Structure are important meaning that it help the reader to understand what you trying to convey and to navigate around the document.

How Page Use Structure

  • Think about your story that you read in the newspaper each story contain a headline , some text if possibly a image. If the article is a long piece There may be a subheading that split the story in to a separate section or quote those involve. Structure is very important it help the reader to understand the story in your news paper.
  • The structure is very similar when the news story are view online ( although some online site may be feature some video or audio )
  • Now think of different kind of documents - an Insurance form. Insurance form often contain different section and each section contain a different question and each question contain a area for you to fill an detail or a checkbox to tick. again the structure is similar to the online.

Structuring Word Documents

  • The use of Heading and Subheading in any documents can often reflect the hierarchy of the information. For example Some Document start with the heading following by the introduction or a important information.
  • This might be expand upon under Subheading lower down on the page. When we use the processor word to create the document. We might need to separate the text to give it structure. Some Topic might add a new paragraph and Each Section might have a head ling to describe what it cover.

HTML Describes The Structure Of Pages

<html> 
	<body>
	    <h1> This is the Main Heading </h1>
	    <p>  This text might be an introduction to the rest of the page. And if the page is a long one it might be split up into several sub-headling. </p>
	    <h2> This is a Sub-heading. </h2>
	    <p> Many long articles have sub-heading so to help you follow the structure of what is being written. There may even be sub-sub-heading ( or lower-level heading.) . </p>
	    <h2> Another Sub-heading</h2>
	    <p> Here you can see another sub-heading. </p>
	  </body>
	</html>
  • The HTML( in blue ) are made up of character inside the angle brackets are call HTML Element. HTML Element are usually made up of 2 tags. Opening tags and Closing tags( The closing tags have a extra forward slash in it). Each HTML Element will tell the Browser something about the information to the site between its Opening tags and Closing tags.

HTML Uses Elements To Describe The Structure Of Pages

  • Tags act like a container. They tell you something about information that lie between the opening tags and closing tags.
  • The opening <html> tags indicate that anything between it and the closing </html> tag is HTML code.
  • The <body> tag indicate that anything between it and the closing </body> tag should be shown inside the main browser window.
  • Word between <h1> and </h1> are a main heading
  • A paragraph of text appear between these <p> and </p> tags.
  • Word between <h2> and </h2> are a sub-heading

A Closer Look At Tags

  • <p> or </p> are the tags
  • <p> ‚Ä¶. </p> are the whole HTML element this include both tag and any content inside them
  • The character inside the bracket indicate the tag purpose. For example the above tag P stand for paragraph.
  • The Enclosing tag have a extra forward slash in it after < symbol.
  • The Term ‚ÄúElement‚Äù and ‚ÄúTag‚Äù can be use interchangeable.
  • Strictly speaking however an element comprises ( consist ) with a opening tag and closing tag and any content will be place between those opening and closing tag

Attribute Tell Us More About Elements

  • Attribute provide additional information about the content of an element. They appear in the opening tags of the element. They make up of 2 parts a name and a value separate by the equal sign.
  • The attribute name indicate that what kind of extra information that you want to supplying to the content of element. it should be written in lowercase
  • The attribute value is a information or setting for a attribute name. it should be place in double quotes. Different attribute got have a different value.
  • Here is the ‚Äúlang‚Äù attribute which indicate what language we trying to use in this element. since we are using language English in this element content the value of these attribute will be specifying to English language
  • The majority of attributes name can only work with a certain of element. although there are few attribute such as ‚Äúlang‚Äù that work with any of element.
  • Most attribute value can be either a predefine or a simulate format.
  • The attribute value of the ‚Äúlang‚Äù attribute can be abbreviated ( short-cut ) to specify the language that you are using in the element that understand by the browser.
<p lang = "en"> This is English Channel </p>
<p lang = "fr"> This is French  Channel </p>

Body , Head & Title

  • <body> : Every content that sit between these <body> element are shown in the main browser window as you see in on page 28 the one that highlight in blue that every content that sit bet ween that <body> element will be shown their.
  • <head> : Before <body> there are <head> element the content that sit between these <head> element is contain the information about the page rather then showing on the main browser window. You will usually find <title> element inside the <head> element.
  • <title> : The content that sit between these <title> element are shown either on top of the browser above where you usually type a URL of the page you want to visit or a tab of the page ( if your browser use a tab that allow you to view multiple page at the same time ). You can see on page 28 the one that highlight in orange .

You may know that HTML are stand for Hyper Text Mark Up Language.

  • The Hyper Text part refer to the fact that HTML allow you to create a link that allow the visitor to move from one page to another page very quickly and easily.
  • The Mark Up part allow you to annotate text . These annotation provide a additional meaning to the content of the document. if you think of the web page we add the code around the original text that we want to display. The Browser then use these code to display the page correctly. So the tag we add are Mark Up.
<html>
   <head>
       <title> This is the title of the Page </title>
    </head>
    <body>
          <h1> This is the body of the page </h1>
          <p> Anything within the body of a web page is displayed in the main browser window.
          </p>
    </body>
 </html>

Creating A Web Page On A PC

Creating A Web Page On A MAC

Code In A Content Management System

Looking At How Other Sites Are Built

SUMMARY CHAPTER ONE : STRUCTURE

CHAPTER TWO : TEXT

When you create a web page you add tags ( Known As Mark Up ) to the content of the page. These Tag provide a extra information that allow the Browser use that tag to show the users appropriate structure of the page.

  • Structural Mark Up : The element use to describe both heading and paragraph.
  • Semantic Mark Up : Which provide extra information , Where emphasis place in the sentence that something you have written in quotation ( who said that ) and the meaning of the acronym and so no .

Headings

HTML has 6 level of handing

<h1>

<h2>

<h3>

<h4>

<h5>

<h6>

<h1> indicate that everything between these element will be the main heading.

<h2> indicate that everything between these element will be the sub heading.

any further section lower than subheading the users might use the element <h3> and so on

by the meaning so on indicate that if any further section lower than <h3> the users might use the element <h4>.

Browser display the content of the heading in different size. the content within the element <h1> will be the largest and the content within the element <h6> will be the smallest. The exact size at which each browser show the heading can be vary slightly. The user can adjust the size of the text in their browser

<html>
	<body>
		<h1> This is the main heading </h1>
		<h2> This is the sub heading </h2>
		<h3> This is the sub sub heading </h3>
		<h4> This is the sub sub sub heading </h4>
		<h5> This is the sub sub sub sub heading </h5>
		<h6> This is the sub sub sub sub sub heading </h6>
	</body>
</html>

Paragraphs

<p>

To create a paragraphs surround the word that make of paragraph with the opening tags <p> and closing </p>.

By default Browser will show the paragraph on the new line with some space between it and any subsequent paragraph

<html>
	<body>
		<p> A paragraph consists of one or more sentences that form a self-contained unit of discourse. The start of a paragraph is indicated by a new line. </p>
		<p> Text is easier to understand when it is split up into units of text. For example, a book may have chapters. Chapters can have subheadings. Under each heading there will be one or more paragraphs. </p>
		</body>
	</html>

Bold And Italic

<b>

By enclosing the word in the tag <b> we just make our character appear bold.

The <b> element can be represent a section of text visually different. By example a keyword in the paragraph. Although using this did not imply any meaningful at all 

<html>
	<body>
		<p> This is how we make a word appear <b> bold </b>.
		<p> Inside a product description you might see some <b> key features</b> in bold </p>
		</body>
	<body>

<i>

By enclosing the word in the tag <i> we just make our character appear italics.

The <i> element can be represent a section of text that would be said in different from the surrounding content. such as technical term , name of ships , foreign word , thought and other terms that would usually be italicized. 

<html>
	<body>
		<p> This is how we make a word appear <i> italic </i>.
		<p> It's a potato <i> Solanum teberosum. </i>
		<p> Captain Cook sailed to Australia on the <i> Endeavour </i>.
		</body>
	</html>

Superscript And Subscript

<sup>

The <sup> element is used to contain a character that should be superscript such as a suffice of dates or a mathematical concept a raising number to a power like for example 222^222Ôªø.

<html>
		<body>
			<p> On the 4 <sup> th </sup> of September you will learn about 
			E = MC <sup> 2 </sup> .
			</body>
</html>

<sub>

The <sub> element is used to contain a character that should be subscript it‚Äôs commonly use in footnotes or a chemical element.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> The amount of CO <sub> 2 </sub> in the atmosphere grew by 2pm in 2009 <sub> 1 </sub>
		</body>
 </html>

White Space

In order to make code easier to read. web author often add a extra space or put a element on a new line

When the browser come across two or more space it will only display it as a one space similarly if the browser come across the line break it simply treat it as a one space meaning that it only display as a one space. This known as White Space Collapsing.

You will often see web author use these White Space Collapsing as a advantage to intent their code in order to make it easy to follow. 

<html>
	<body>
		<p> Treat as a one space </p>
		<p> Treat as                           a one space </p>
		<p> Treat 
		as 
		a one space </p>
		</body>
</html>

Line Break And Horizontal Rule

<br />

As you already seen. The browser automatically put show the new paragraph and heading in the newline if we try to add the line break in the middle of paragraph which mean a character will simply in the newline so we can use the <br />.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> The Earth <br /> gets one hundred tons heavier every day <br /> due to falling space dust. </p>
		</body>
	</html>

<hr />

To create a line break theme such as when changing a topic , movie , new scene and a new book you can add a horizontal rule between the section using the <hr /> tag.

There are a few element that do not have a word between the opening tags and the closing tags these known are The Empty Element. And they are written differently.

The Empty Element usually have only one tags and before the closing angle of the empty element bracket it often have a space or a forward slash. Some web page author miss about 

<html>
	<body>
		<p> Venus is the only planet that rotates clockwise . </p>
		<hr />
		<p> Jupiter is bigger than all the other planets combined. </p>
		</body>
	</html>

Visual Editors And Their Code Views

Semantic Markup

There are some element that do not indented to affect the structure of the webpage but they do intent to provide extra information. They are known as Semantic Markup.

In the rest of the Chapter you will find more element that will help you when you add text to the web page for example <em> element allow you to indicate where to emphasis the select word and <blockquote> indicate that the block of text is quotation.

Browser often display the content of these element in different way for example every content that sit between these <em> element will be italic and the content that sit between <blockquote> usually intended. But you should not use these element to change how your text look their purpose is that to describe a content of the page more accurately.

The reason we need to use these element is that other program such as screen reader and search engine can use this extra information. For example the screen reader might add a emphasis to the word inside the <em> element. The search engine might register your web page feature quote if you use <blockquote> element.

Strong And Emphasis

<strong>

The use of <strong> element indicate that the content that sit between the <strong> element are strong information example the content that are sit between the <strong> element might be said strong emphasis. and remember the content with in the <strong> element also indicate the the content that sit between is the most important than other text and also the reader must pay attention to it since it‚Äôs the most crucial and should be first prioritize.

By default browser will display the content that sit between this <strong> element as a bold.

<html>
	<body>
		 <p><strong> Beware: </strong> Pickpocketss operate in this area </p>
		 <p> This toy has many small pieces and is <strong> not suitable for children under five year old. </strong> </p>
		 </body>
	</html>

<em>

The use of <em> element indicate that emphasis that subtly change the meaning of the sentence meaning that if the content sit between this <em> element meaning of that content is much important than the other normal text but not as important as a <strong> element level and also reader should pay attention to it.

By default browser will display the content that sit between this <em> element as a italic.

<html>
	<body>
	  <p> I <em> think </em> Ivy was the first. </p>
	  <p> I think <em> Ivy </em> was the first. </p>
	  <p> I think Ivy was the <em> first </em>. </p>
	 </body>
</html>

Quotations

There are two element that commonly use for marking up quotations.

<blockquote>

The <blockquote> element is use for the longer quote that can take up entire paragraph note that the paragraph is still inside the <blockquote> since it take up a paragraph.

Browser tend to intend the content of the <blockquote> element . How ever you should not intend the piece of text using these element. 

<html>
	<body>
			<blockquote>
			  <p> Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again ? </p>
			  </blockquote>
	</body>
	</html>
			       
<html>
	<body>
	  <blockquote cite = "https://mobile-legends.fandom.com/wiki/Ling">
	  <p> I dont know myself either </p>
	  </blockquote>
	 </body>
</html>

<q>

The <q> element is use for the shorter that sit within the paragraph how-ever browser supposed to put quote between this <q> element but the internet explorer are not. so that the reason some people avoid <q> element.

Both element(<q> and <blockquote> may use cite and attribute to indicate where the quote is from and the attribute value should contain a URL that will tell us more about the information about source of the quotation

<html>
  <body>
      <p> As A.A. Milne said , <q> Some people talk to animals. Not many listen though. That's the problem. </q> </p>
      </body>
  </html>
<html>
	<body>
		<p> My name is Yin and I should be <q cite ="https://mobile-legends.fandom.com/wiki/Ling"> I dont know myself </q>
		</p>
		</body>
	</html>

Abbreviation And Acronyms

<abbr>

if you use the Abbreviation or the Acronyms you use the <abbr> element. The title attribute in the opening tag of the <abbr> element is use to specify a full term of that Abbreviation or Acronyms.

In HTML4 we use the separate <acronyms> element for the acronyms and use the title attribute to specify a full term of that acronyms. But in HTML5 we use <abbr> for both Abbreviation And Acronyms.

by default any content that sit between <abbr> browser will display in a italics.

<html>
	<body>
	  <p> Prof Stephen Hawking is theoretical physicist and cosmologist </p>
	  <p><abbr> NASA </abbr> do some crazy space stuff.
	 </body>
	</html>
	
<html>
	<body>
		<p> Prof Stephen Hawking is theoretical physicist and cosmologist </p>
		<p><abbr title="Nation Aeronautics and Space Administration"> do some crazy space stuff </p>
	</body>
</html>

Citations And Definitions

<cite>

when you referencing a piece of work such as research paper , book or file we use the <cite> element to indicate where the citation is from.

In HTML5 we don't allow <cite> element for the people name but HTML4 allow with people name so that the reason people still continue using it.

Any content that sit between these <cite> element browser will be display in italics.

<html>
 <body>
  <p><cite> A Brief History of Time </cite> by Step Hawking has sold 
  over ten million copies world wide </p>
 </body>
</html>

<dfn>

The first time you explain a new terminology ( such as a academy concept or jargon ) in the document. it‚Äôs indicate defining the instance of it .

When we use the <dfn> element we indicate that we defining the instance of the new term

Some browser will display the content between these <dfn> element in italics. +

Browser and Safari doesn‚Äôt change appearance.

<html>
	<body>
	 <p> A <dfn> black hole </dfn> is a region of space from which nothing, not even light , can escape </p>
	 </body>
	</html>

Author Details

<address>

The <address> element are quite specific use: to contain a contact detail for the author of the web page.

The address could be contain with a physical address. But it may not have to. It may contain a phone number or a email address.

The browser will display the content that sit between these <address> element in italics.

You may be interest of something called HCap microformat for adding physical address information to your markup.

<html>
	<body>
		<address>
			<p> 01112342324 </p>
			<p> arifindepayjr@gmail.com </p>
			</address>
		</body>
	</html>

Change To Content

<ins>

The use of that <ins> element is to show the content have been insert in to the document.

The content that sit between this <ins> element usually display as underline.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> It's was the <ins> best </ins> product ever </p>
		</body>
	</html>

<del>

The use of that <del> indicate that the text have been delete.

The content that sit between this <del> element usually display as a line throught it.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> It was the <del> worst </del> best product ever </p>
	</body>
</html>

<s>

The use of the <s> element indicate that the word is no longer accurate , not relevant ( but should not delete it like <del> ).

The content that sit between this <s> element will be display as a line through the center.

Other HTML code use <u> element to make the content underline. but this is being phrase out.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> Laptop Computer </p>
		<p><s> was 1000$ </s></p>
		<p> right now 899$ </p>
	</body>
</html>

Example Text

This is a very simple HTML page that demonstrates test markup :

  • Structure Markup : include the element that descript both the heading and the paragraph
  • Semantic Markup : contain the element such as <cite> , <em>
<html>
	<head>
		 <title> Text </title>
	</head>
	<body>
		<h1> The Story in the Book </h1>
		<h2> Chapter 1 </h2>
		<p> Molly had been staring out of her window for about an hour now. On her desk, lying between the copies of <cite> Nature , New Scientist, </cite> and all other scientific journals her work had appeard in, was a well thumbed copy of <cite> On The Road </cite>. It had been Molly's favourite book since college, and the longer she spend in these four walls the more she felt she needed to be free. </p>
		<p> She has spent the last ten years in this room, sitting under a poster with an Oscar Whide quote proclaimming that <q> Work is the refuge of people who have nothing better to do. </q> Although may considerd her pioneering work , unraveling the secrets of the llma  <abbr title = "Deoxyribonucleic acid"> DNA <abbr> , to be an outstanding achievement, Molly <em> did </em> think she had something better to do.
		</body>
	</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER TWO : TEXT

CHAPTER THREE : LISTS

There are a lot of occasion When we need to use list. In HTML provide us a three different type :

  • Ordered lists : is a list where each item in the list is numbered. For example the set of step for a recipe will be perform in order or the legal contract where each point need to identifier by the section of number.
  • Unordered lists : where the list are in bullet point ( rather than character or number indicate order ) .
  • Definition lists : are made up of the set of term along with the definitions for each of those terms.

Ordered Lists

<ol>

To create a order list we need to use the <ol> element.

<li>

Each item should be place between in this <li> tag and the closing </li>. ( The li stand for list ).

Browser intent the list by default.

Sometime you will see the attribute in the <ol> opening tag to specify the numbered ( character , roman number , letter ‚Ä¶ ) it‚Äôs better to use CSS instead.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> Rice Cambodia Recipe </p>
		<ol>
			<li> Egg </li>
			<li> Oil </li>
			<li> Butter </li>
			<li> Onion </li>
		</ol>
	</body>
</html>

Unordered Lists

<ul>

To create a unorder list we need to use the <ul> element.

<li>

Each item should be place between in this <li> tag and closing </li>. ( The li stand for list ).

Browser intent the list by default.

Sometime you will see the attribute in the <ul> opening tag to specify the bullet point ( squares , circle , diamond .. ) it‚Äôs better to use CSS instead.

<html>
	<body>
		<p> To do list </p>
		<ul>
			<li> Shower </li>
			<li> Make Bed </li>
			<li> School </li>
			<li> Exercise </li>
		</ul>
	</body>
</html>

Definition Lists

<dl>

To create a definition lists we need to use <dl> element and usually contain a series of term and their definition.

Inside the <dl> element you will usually see the pair of <dt> and <dd> element.

<dt>

<dt> element use to contain the term being defined.

<dd>

<dd> element use to contain the definition of the term.

<html>
	<body>
		<dl>
			<dt> Sashimi </dt>
			<dd> Sliced raw fish that is served with
			condiments such as shredded daikon or ginger root. wasabi and
			soy sauce. </dd>
			<dt> Scale </dt>
			<dd> A device used to accurately measure the weight of ingredients>
			<dd>
			A techique by which the scales are removed from the skin of a fish </dd>.
			<dt> Scamorze </dt>
			<dt> Scamorzo </dt>
			<dd> An italian cheese usually made form whole cow's milk 
			( although it was traditionally made from buffalo milk ).
			</dd>
			</body>
		</html>

Nested Lists

You can put a second list inside an <li> element to create a sub-list or a nested lists.

Browser will display nested list intent further than the parent lists. The nested unorder lists , The browser will usually changing the bullet point too

<html>
	<body>
		<ul>
			<li> Mousses </li>
			<li> Pastries 
			<ul>
				 <li> Croissant </li>
				 <li> Mille-feuille </li>
				 <li> Palmier </li>
				 <li> Profiterole </li>
			</ul>
			</li>
			<li> Tarts </li>
		</body>
	</html>

Example lists

Here you can see a main heading followed by an introductory paragraph. An unordered list is used to outline the ingredients and an ordered list is used to describe the steps.

<html>
	<body>
		<h1> Scrambled Eggs </h1>
		<p> Egg are one of my favorite foods. Here is a recipe for deliciously rich srambled eggs. </p>
		<h2> Ingredients </h2>
		<ul>
		 <li> 2 eggs </li>
		 <li> 1tbs butter </li>
		 <li> 2tbs cream </li>
		 </ul>
		 <h2> Method </h2>
		 <ol>
		  <li> Melt butter in a frying pen over medium heat </li>
		  <li> Gently mix the eggs and cream in a bowl </li>
		  <li> Once butter has melted add cream and eggs </li>
		  <li> Using a spatula fold the egg form the edge of the pan 
		  to the center every 20 seconds ( as if you are makjing an omelette ) </li>
		  <li> When the eggs are still moist remove from the heat ( it will continue to cook the plate until served ) . </li>
		  </body>
		  </html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER THREE : LISTS

CHAPTER FOUR : LINKS

Links are the defining feature in the web they allow you to move from one web page to another - enabling the very idea of browsing and surfing.

You will commonly come across this type of link :

  • Links from one Website to another.
  • Links from one Webpage to another Webpage on the same Website.
  • Links from one part in the Webpage to another part within the same Webpage.
  • Links that open a new browser window.
  • Links that enable a email program and address email to someone.

Writing Links

Links are create using the <a> element. Users can click Anything between the opening <a> tag and the closing </a> tag When they do they will link to somewhere <a> is specify. You specify which the web page that you are linking to using href attribute inside the opening <a> tag. So when user clicking any thing between this <a> element with the attribute which indicate which webpage it linking to users can move to that web page.

<html>
	<body>
		<a href="http://www.imdb.com"> IMDB </a>
	</body>
</html>

The text between the opening tag <a> and the closing </a> that user can click anything between these <a> element is known as Link Text. Where possible you should explain the visitor where it taken off when users click ion t rather than saying ‚ÄúPlease Click Here‚Äù.

Many People navigate the website scanning text for links. Clear text help the visitor find what they looking at and also This will give them more positive impression about your site and may be encourage them to visit longer. ( This is also help people with the screen reader software ).

To write a good link text you might think of word people might use when searching for the website that you are linking to. For example rather than saying ‚ÄúPlace to Stay‚Äù we could provide more specific information such as ‚ÄúHotel In News York‚Äù.

Linking To Other Sites

<a>

Links are create using a <a> element with the href attribute. The value of href attribute will be the page which taken the visitor to when they click on it.

Users can click anything that sit between the opening <a> tag and the closing </a> and the one that specify where visitor will taken off when they click on it. it‚Äôs a href attribute.

When you link to a different website the value of the href attribute will be a full web address for that site which known as an Absolute URL.

The browser will display the link in a blue with the underline by default.

<html>
		<body>
		<ol>
		  <li><a href= "http://www.empireonline.com">Empire </a></li>
		  <li><a href= "http://www.metacritic.com">Metacritic </a></li>
		  <li><a href= "http://www.rottentomatoes.com">Rotten Tomatores </a></li>
		  <li><a href= "http://www.variety.com"> Varitety </a></li>
		 </ol>
	</body>
</html>

Absolute URL

URL stand for Uniform Resources Locator. Every webpage has it own URL. This is the Web address that you usually type in the browser when you want to visit a specific page.

An Absolute URL start with the domain name of that site. Following by the path to the specific page that you want to visit. if no page you want to visit site will display the home page instead.

Linking To Other Page Within The Same WebSite

<a>

When you linking to other page within the same Website you do not need to specify A domain name or hosting. You can use the shorthand known as Relative URL.

If all the different Webpage with in the same Website is in the same folder. The value of attribute was just the name of that file.

if all the different Webpage with in the same Website is in the different folder. You need to use the slightly more complex syntax to indicate where the Webpage is relation to the current page.

<html>
	<body>
	   <ol>
	     <li><a href="index.html"> index </a></li>
	     <li><a href="home.html"> home </a></li>
	     <li><a href="movie.html"> movie </a></li>
	     <li><a href="contact.html"> contact </a></li>
	    </ol>
	   </body>
	  </html>

Relative URL

When linking to other Webpage within the same Website we need to use the shorthand known as Relative URL. These are like the shorthand version of the Absolute URL because you no need to specify the domain name or hosting.

Relative URL Help when building site in your computer because you can create link between page and without having to set up domain name or hosting.

Directory Structure

On larger Website it‚Äôs a good idea to organize your code by placing a pages for a different section on the site in a new folder. This folder on a website are sometime refer to as directories.

Structure

The diagram show from above is a Directories Structure for a Fictional Entertainment listing Website called Example Arts..

The top level of the folder are called the Root folder ( for example in our diagram the root folder are called ‚Äúexamplearts‚Äù folder ) which contain other file and folder of the website.

Each section of the page are place in the separate folder. This allow to organize the file.

Relationships

The relationship between the file and folder are describe using the same terminology as a family tree.

In the diagram from the Above you can see the relationship have drawn in.

The examplearts folder is the parent of the movie , music and theater folder . while the movie , music and theater folder are the child of the example arts folder.

Homepages

The main homepage of the website are written in HTML code ( the home page of each section in the children folder ) is called index.html.

Web server will return to the home page in our case it‚Äôs a index.html if no file is specify.

Therefore if you enter www.exampleart.com since it‚Äôs no file to specify it will return to www.exampleart.com/index.html same as this www.exampleart.com/movies since there no file specific in the movies folder it will return to the file name index like this www.exampleart.com/movies/index.html .

If you working with a content management system , blogging software and e-commerce system you might not have a individual file for each page of the website . Instead these system use a template file for a each different page ( articles new , blogging , product ) . Editing on the template file all the page that using that same template file will going to change. Do not change the code that is not HTML or you will break the page.

Every page and Every Image has it own URL ( Uniform Resources Locator ) . The URL is a made up domain which follow the path to a specific file or image.

The path to our main homepage is www.exampleart.com/index.html and the path to our image logo is www.examplearts.com/images/logo.gif.

The use of URL( Uniform Resources Locator ) is when you want to linking to other webpage , website and also adding image to you own site.

The root folder contain :

  • A file call index.html which is the homepage of the entire of website
  • Individual folder for movies , music and theater for a section of the site.

Each sub-directories contain :

  • A file called index.html which is the homepage of each section
  • A review pages call review.html
  • A listing page call listing.html ( except the DVD folder )

The movies section contain :

  • A folder called Cinema
  • A folder called DVD

Relative URLS

You use Relative URL When you linking a from one Webpage to another Webpage in the same Website this provide a shorthand way to tell the browser where the find the file.

When you linking from one Webpage to another Webpage within the same website You need to use Relative URLS. Which are the shorthand way to tell the browser which page is relation to the current page.

This is especially helpful when you need to create a website or learn HTML because you can create link between a page in only your personal computer ( before you have a domain name upload to the web ) .

Because you no need to repeat a domain name in every each link which is also easier to write.

if all the Webpage file stay all within the same folder you only need to specify the file name nothing more.

but if the Webpage file is organize in a separate folder you need to tell the browser how to get to the Webpage that you currently on to the Webpage you are linking to.

If you link to the same page from the different page you might therefore need to different two Relative URL.

These links make use of the same terminology that you borrow from the family tree from the previous page which introduce Directories Structure.

Relative Link Type

When the Website is live ( that is upload to the web server ) you may see a couple other techniques used that don't work when the file are on the your local computer.

For example you may see the name of the child folder but you may not see the name of the child name. In this case the Webserver will usually to show the homepage of that section.

A forward slash with no file to follow will be return to the homepage of the entire site and the forward slash follow a file will return to file that providing it‚Äôs in the root directories.

Email Links

mailto:

To create a link that open the users email program and address email to the specific email. You can use the <a> element with the attribute href but this time the value of the href attribute start with the mailto follow by the email address that you want the email to be sent to.

<html>
	<body>
		<a href="mailto:arifindepayjr@gmail.com"> arifin </a>
	</body>
	</html>

As you can see from the above it‚Äôs just like other link but when the users click on it. It will be open the users email program the new email message and address to the person specific by the attribute value.

Open Link In the New Window

target:

If you want your link to open in the new window we need to use the attribute target in the opening <a> tag and the value of the target attribute should be _blank.

<html>
	<body>
		<a href= "https://www.imdb.com" target="_blank"> imdb </a>
	</body>
</html>

The common reason that the Website author want to open the new window if it point to another website. In such case that we hope the users will return to the browser containing their site after finishing looking other website.

Linking To the Specific Part Of The Same Page

At the top of page you might want to add a list of content that link to the corresponding section down to the page. Or you might want add link from the part at the button down page Back to top. This will save users from scrolling back to the top.

Before you can link to the specific part of the page you need to identify the point in the page. you can do that by using the ID attribute ( which can be use with every HTML element ). As you can see the <h1> and <h2> element down below this element is given a ID attribute which identify the section of the page.

The value of the ID attribute start with a letter or a underscore but not the number or a character. two ID attribute should not have the same value.

To links to the element that use the ID attribute we need to use <a> element but his time the value of the href attribute should start with a ‚Äò#‚Äô symbol follow by the value of the ID attribute of the element that you want to linking to. for example <a href= #top> top </a> as you know the content that sit between the <a> element is a link text which users can click on that when the users click on that it give to the link that specify by the href in our case since oy href is link to the ID attribute which value is top and our <h1 id=‚Äùtop‚Äù> having that value. So we are linking to that <h1> since the href attribute value is top and it see the id of the <h1> is top.

<html>
	<body>
		<h1 id="top"> Film-Making Terms </h1>
		<a href="#Arcshot"> Arc Shot </a>
		<a href="#Interlude"> Interlude </a>
		<a href="#Prologue"> Prologue </a>
		<h2 id="Arcshot"> Arc Shot </h2>
		<p> A shot in which the subject is photographed by an encircling or moving camera </p>
		<h2 id="Interlude"> Interlude </h2>
		<p> A brief, intervening film scene or sequence, not specifically tied to the plot, that appear within a film </p>
		<h2 id="Prologue"> Prologue </h2>
		<p> A speech, preface , introduction or brief scene preceding the main action or plot of a film contrash to epilogue </p>
		<a href="#top"> Top </a>
	</body>
</html>

Linking To A Specific Part Of Another Page

if you want to link to specific part on other page it either your own page or other online page you can use the similar technique.

As long as the page that you are linking to have a ID attribute that indentify specific point in the page you can simply use the same syntax at the end of the link for that page.

Therefore the value of href attribute will contain an address it either the Absolute URL or Relative URL following by the ‚Äò#‚Äô symbol and the value of the ID attribute that use on the element that you want to linking to.

<html>
	<body>
		<a href="exampleart/#Arcshot"> Arc shot </a>
		<a href="exampleart/#Interlude"> Interlude </a>
		<a href="exampleart/#Prologue"> Prologue </a>
		<a href="exampleart/#botton"> botton of the page </a>
	</body>
</html>
<html>
	<body>
		<h1> Top </h1>
		<h2 id="Arcshot"> Arcshot </h2>
		<p> the shot of arcshot </p>
		<h2 id="Interlude"> Interlude </h2>
		<p> the inderlude of inderlude </p>
		<h2 id="Prologue"> Prologue </h2>
		<p> the prologue of prologue </p>
	<h3 id = "botton"> botton </h3>
</body>
</html>

Example Links

This example is of a web page about film.

The <h1> element is used with an id attribute at the op of the page so that a link can be added to take readers from the botton of the page to the top. There is an email link to allow reader to contact the author of the web page. There alre also a number of links to qualified URLs. These link to various film festivals. Below this is a link to relative URL which is an about page that lives in the same directory.

<html>
    <head><title>Links</title></head>
    <body>
        <h1 id="Top"> Film Folk </h1>
        <h2> Festival Diary </h2>
        <p> Here are some of the film festivals we 
            will be attending this year. Please <a href="mailto:arifindepayjr@gmail.com"> contact us</a>
            if you would like more information.
        </p>
        <h3>January</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="https://www.sundance.org/">Sundance Film Festival</a>
        <p>Park City, Utah, USA</p>
        <p>20 - 30 January 2011</p>

        <h3>February</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="http://www.tropfest.com/">Tropfest</a>
        <p>Sydney, Australia</p>
        <p>20 February 2011</p>

        <h3>March</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="http://sxsw.com/">South by Southwest</a>
        <p>Austin, Texas, USA</p>
        <p> 11 - 20 March 2011</p>

        <h3>April</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="http://www.londonindependent.org/">London Independent Film Festival</a>
        <p>London , UK</p>
        <p>15 - 24 April 2011</p>

        <h3>May</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="http://www.festival-cannes.com/"> Cannes International Film Festival </a>
        <p>Cannes, France</p>
        <p>11 - 22 May 2011</p>

        <h3>June</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="https://www.sff.org.au/"> Sydney Film Festival </a>
        <p>Sydney , Australia </p>
        <p>8 - 19 June 2011</p>

        <h3>July</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="https://www.miff.com.au/">Melbourne International Film Festival </a>
        <p> Melbourne, Victoria Australia </p>
        <p> 22 july - 7 Auguest 2011</p>

        <h3>Auguest</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="http://www.nzff.co.nz/"> New Zealand International Film Festival </a>
        <p> Dunedin, New Zealand </p>
        <p>4 - 25 Auguest 2011</p>

        <h3>September</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="https://www.labiennale.org/en/cinema/2024"> Venice Film Festival </a>
        <p> Venice, Italy </p>
        <p> 31 Auguest - 10 September 2011</p>

        <h3>October</h3>
        <br />
        <a href=http://www.bfi.org.uk/lff/">London Film festival</a>
        <p>London , UK </p>
        <p> 12 - 27 October 2011 </p>

        <br />

        <p> Amsterdam , Netherlands</p>
        <p> 16 - 27 November 2011 </p>

        <h3>December</h3>
        <br />
        <a href="http://whistlerfilmfestival.com/">Whisler Film Festival </a>
        <p>Whistler BC Canada</p>
        <p>30 November - 4 December 2011 </p>
        
        <a href="About Films/Films/About.html"> About Film Folk </a>
        <br />
        <a href="#Top"> Top of page </a>

    </body>
</html>
<html>
    <head><title>Film Folk</title></head>
    <body>
        <h1>Film FOlk</h1>
        <p>Film Folk is not for profit
            website dedicated to independent Film
            . We seek to support and inspire 
            artists and to introduce their work
            to worldwide audiences.
        </p>
        <a href="../../CHAPTER4X.html"> back </a>
    </body>
</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER FOUR : LINKS

CHAPTER FIVE : IMAGES

There are many reason that you might want to add an images to your webpage. These might include Logo , Photograph , Illustration , Diagram or Chart.

There are several things you might be consider when preparing images or selecting images for your site. But taking time to get them right will make them look more attractive and professional. In this Chapter you will learn how to :

  • Pick Which images format to use
  • Show the images at the right size
  • Add Images to your site using HTML
  • Optimized your image on your site to make your page load faster.

Choosing Images For Your Site

A picture can say a thousand word and great images can help make the different between the average normal looking website and the engaged one.

Images can be set the tone of the site in less time than it take to read the description. If you dont have any photograph to use in the own website. You can look at the the company who sell the stock of images. These images you pay to use ( There the list of stock of images website below ). Remember All of the images are subject to the copy right meaning that you will get in to trouble if you simple taking a photograph from another website. If you have a webpage that show a several images ( Product photograph or a member of the team ) than putting them on a simple consistent background it will help to make them look better as a group.

IMAGES SHOULD :

  • Convey information
  • Convey in the right mood
  • Be relevant
  • Fit the color palette
  • Be instantly recognizable

Storing Images On Your Site

If you build your own website from scratch. It‚Äôs the best practice to create a folder and put all the image that your site uses in to that folder.

As the site grow putting the images on the separate folder. Help you understand how the site is organized. As the example from the above all the file for website and all the image that the website is used are place in separate folder called images.

On the big site you might want to add a subfolder in the images folder. For example Images such as logo or button should be place in the folder called interface. Product photograph should be sit in the page call Product. Images that related to the news should be live in the folder called news.

Adding Images

<img>

to add image to your site you need to use the <image /> element this is a empty element which mean it got only a open tag before the enclosed bracket it‚Äôs a forward slash ( while some author ignore it ) and got no content shit between it. It must carry following these two attribute.

src

This tell the browser where the image of the file. This is usually a relative URL ( Uniform Resources Locator ) that point to the image of your site. ( For this example below the images are in the child folder called Images ) .

alt

This provide a description information of the image which describe the image. if you can not see it .

title

We can use the title attribute with the <img /> element to provide a additional information for the image. Most browser will display the content of that title attribute in a tooltip when the users hover over the images.

The text that use in the alt attribute are refer to Alt text. it should give a accurate description of the image content so it can be understand by other software like screen reader software ( use by the people with the vision impairment ) or a search engine .

If the image was add to make the page look attractive which mean it got no meaning at all for example a graphic dividing line. Then the alt attribute should still be use but the quote ( value of that attribute ) should be empty line.

<html>
	<body>
		<img src    = "images/quokka.jpg" 
		     alt    = "A family of quokka" 
		     title  = "The quokka is an Australian marsupial that is similar in size to the                   domestic cat." />
		</body>
	</html>

Height And Width Of Images

You will often see <img /> element are use with other attribute that specify the size.

height

This uses to specific the height for the images in pixel.

width

This uses to specific the width for the images in pixel.

Images often load longer than the html code that make up the rest of the page. it‚Äôs therefore the best idea to specify the size of the image so the browser can render the rest of the text of the page while it leaving some amount of space for the image that still loading.

<html>
	<body>
		<img src    = "images/quokka.jpg" 
		     alt    = "A family of of quokka" 
		     width  = "600" 
		     height = "450" />
	</body>
</html>

Where To Place Images In Your Code

Where you place in the image in the code will affect how it is display here is the three example how the image placement produce different result.

1 : Images Place before the paragraph

The paragraph will start on the new line after the images. ( see the images above )

2 : Images Place inside the start of the paragraph

The row of text will align with the bottom of the images. ( see the images above )

3 : Images Place in the middle of the paragraph

The images is place between the word of the paragraph appear in. ( see the images above )

Where you place the images in the code is important that because the browser will show the HTML element in one or two way :

  • Block element is always appear on the new line : Example of the block element include <h1> to <h6> element and <p> element. If the <img> is follow by the block level element then the block level element will sit on the newline after the images is show in the first example ( see the images above ) .
  • Inline element that sit in the block element and do not start at the new line : Example o the inline element <img /> , <b> and <em> ‚Ä¶ if the <img> element is inside the block element any text or other inline element will start flowing around the images as shown in the second example and third example ( see the images above ).
<head>
	<body>
		<img src      = "images/quokka.jpg" 
		     alt      = "quokka standing" 
		     title    = "quoakka stading straight" 
		     height   = "100" 
		     width    = "100">
		     <p> There are around 10,000 living species of birds that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many species undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
	<hr />
	<p><img src     = "images/quokka.jpg" 
	        alt     = "quokka standing " 
	        title   = "quokka standing straight" 
	        height  = "100" 
	        width   = "100"> There are around 10,000 living species of birds that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many specis undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
	<hr />
	<p> there are around 10,000 living species of bird that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic 
	<img src      = "images/quokka.jpg" 
		   alt      = "quokka standing" 
	     title    = "quokka standing straight" 
			 height   = "100"  
	     width    = "100" > 
	     Many species undertake long distance annual migrations , and many more perfrom shorter irregualar journeys.
	</body>
</html>

Old Code: Aligning Images Horizontally

align

The align attribute are commonly use to indicate the other part of the page should flow around an images. This attribute have been remove from HTML and new website should use CSS to control the alignment of an images.

I have discussed it here because you will likely to come across this when you look at the older code because some Visual editor still using this attribute to indicate how an images should be align

The align horizontal should take this value :

  • left : These align the image to the left ( allowing other text and other inline element flow around to the right-hand side )
  • right : These align the image to the right ( allowing other text and other inline element flow around to the left-hand side ) 
<html>
	<body>
		<p><img src    = "images/quokka.jpg"
		        alt    = "quokka is standing straight" 
		        title  = "quokka standing " 
		        height = "100" 
		        width  = "100" 
		        align  = "left" /> 
		        There are around 10,000 living species of birds that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many species undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
	<hr />
	<p><img src    = "images/quokka.jpg" 
	        alt    = "quokka standing straight" 
	        height = "100" 
	        width  = "100" 
	        align  = "right" /> 
	        There are around 10,000 living species of birds that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many species undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
		</body>
		</html>

This look a lot of neater than having one text line next to the image ( on the previous page in example two )

When you give the value of the align attribute to the left. That images will be place to the left other text and other inline element will flow around it.

When you give the value of the align attribute to the right. That images will be place to the right other text and other inline element will flow around it.

Old Code: Aligning Images Vertically

As you saw on the previous page that align attribute have been remove from the HTML5 and you should use the CSS to control how to align the images. But you may still see it use in the older website and it‚Äôs still use in the code create by some visual editor.

You can how and Use the CSS to achieve the same effect in CSS on page 285 - 286.

There are three value of the align attribute can use to take that control how the images should be align in vertical with the text surrounding it.

  • Top : This align the first line of the surrounding text with the top of the images.
  • middle : This align the first line of the surrounding text with the middle of the images.
  • bottom : This align the first line of the surrounding text with the bottom of the images. 
<html>
	<body>
		<p><img src    = "images/quokka.jpg" 
		        alt    = "quokka is standing straight"
		        title  = "quokka is standing"
		        height = "100"
		        width  = "100"
		        align  = "top" />
		        There are around 10,000 living species of bird that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many species undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
		<hr />
		<p><img src    = "images/quokka.jpg"
		        alt    = "quokka is standing straight"
		        title  = "quokka is standing"
		        height = "100"
		        width  = "100"
		        align  = "middle" />
		        There are around 10,000 living species of bird that inhabit different ecosystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many species undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
		 <hr />
		 <p><img src    = "images/quokka.jpg"
		         alt    = "quokka is standing straight"
		         title  = "quokka is standing"
		         height = "100"
		         width  = "100"
		         align  = "botton" />
		         There are around 10,000 living species of birds that inhabit diffferent ecoystems from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Many species undertake long distance annual migrations, and many more perfrom shorter irregular journeys. </p>
	  </body>
	</html>

The value of the top place the first line of text near the top of the images. The subsequent line of text appear under the images.

The value of the middle place the first line of text near the middle vertical of the images. The subsequent line of the text appear under the images.

The value of the bottom place the first line of text near the bottom of the images. The subsequent line of text appear under the images.

Three Rules for Creating Images

There are three rule to remember when create images for your Website. Which we summarize down below. We will go into greater detail for each topic over the next nine pages.

1 Save Images At The Right Format

Website mainly use images in jpeg , png , gif format. If you choose the wrong image format. You image might be not look as sharp as it should and also it make the Webpage load slower.

2 Save Images At The Right Size

You should download the image the same size as it appear on the website ( meaning that you should download the same height , width the same as it appear on the website ) . If the images is smaller than the width or height that you have specific ( meaning that if you save from the website is height = ‚Äú100‚Äù , width = ‚Äú100‚Äù but you specific on your website is height = ‚Äú20‚Äù , width = ‚Äú20‚Äù) the images might be distorted or stretched and if the image is larger than the width or height you have specific ( meaning that if you save from the website is height = ‚Äú100‚Äù , width = ‚Äú100‚Äù but you specific on your website is height = ‚Äú200‚Äù , width = ‚Äú200‚Äù ) the images might take longer to display .

3 Choose The Correct Resolution

The computer screen are make up of the tiny dot call pixel. The image that use on the webpage are made up of the tiny dot. Resolution are refer to number of dot per inch. Most computer screen only show the webpage at 72 pixel per inch. So saving the images at the higher resolution result in the images that are larger than necessary and take longer to download .

Tools To Edit And Save Images

There are several tools that you can use to save the images or edit the images to ensure they are at the right size , format , and resolution.

The most popular tool amongst the Web professional is Adobe photoshop ( in fact Professional Web Designer are using this software to design the entire site ) . The full version of Photoshop is expensive but you can use the cheaper version call Photoshop element which would suit the need of most beginner.

Other Software :

  • Adobe Fireworks
  • Pixelmator
  • PaintShop Pro
  • Paint.net

Online Editors :

  • www.photoshop.com
  • www.pixlr.com
  • www.splashup.com
  • www.ipiccy.com

Images Format : JPEG

Whenever you have different color in a picture you should use JPEG. A picture that feature a snow or a overcast sky might just look like a large area are just white or gray but this picture is make up of many different color that are subtly different.

Images Format : GIF

Use GIF or PNG when saving a images with a few color or a large area fill with the same color.

When you have a picture that have a area fill with the exactly same color it‚Äôs known as a flat color. Picture like diagram , logos , illustration are often use the flat color ( Note that picture like snow ,sky , grass are not flat color they are made of subtly different shades of the same color and they are not suited to GIF or PNG format.

Images Dimensions

The images you use on the website should be saved the same width and height that you want them appear on the page.

For example if the Webpage including the images that is 300 pixel wide by 150 pixel tall the images that you are using is 300 x 150 pixels. You can use the editing tool to resize and crop the images. When sourcing the images it‚Äôs really important to understand how you can alter the dimension of the images that you have design in the webpage to include the images that is 300 pixel wide by 150 pixel tall.

Reducing The Size

You can reduce the size of the images to create a smaller version of that images.

Example : if your images is 600 pixel wide and 300 pixel tall you can reduce the size by 50%.

Result : You create the image that are quicker to download.

Increasing The Size

You cant increasing the size of the photo significantly without affecting the photo quality.

Example : if your images is 100 pixel wide and 50 pixel tall increasing the size of the images by 300% will be result in poor quality.

Result : Your images might be blocky or blurry.

Changing Shape

Only some images can be crop without losing valuable information.

Example : if your images is 300 pixel square you can remove some part ( using cropping ) but doing so you might remove some valuable information.

Result : Some images can be crop and make sense.

Cropping Images

When cropping the images it‚Äôs really important not to lose some of the valuable part. It is best to source the images that are correct shape if possible

Images Resolution

Images that use on the website should be saved at the resolution of 72ppi ( pixel per inched ) . The Higher resolutions of images the larger size of the file .

JPGs , GIF and PNGs is belong to the type of the image format known as Bitmap. They are made up of the lot miniature ( tiny ) square. The resolution images is a number of square that fit within a 1 inched x 1 inched square area.

Images appear on the computer screen are made of tiny square call pixels. A small segment of this photograph have been magnificent to show how it is make of the pixels.

The Web Browser on most desktop computer display the images at the resolution of 72ppi ( pixel per inched ). The images that are in the print material are made of the tiny circle call dots. This images usually print at the resolution of 300dpi ( dot per inched ) .

Due in the face that computer are capped at the resolution of 72 ppi. Higher resolution images on the Website will be not result in display quality images also it‚Äôs increase the time need to load them. therefore it slow down viewing the webpage.

Vector Images

Vector images are differ from the bitmap images and are resolution independent. Vector images commonly create in program called Adobe Illustration.

When an images is line drawing ( illustration , logo , diagram ). Designer often create in the vector format. Vector format image are different from the bitmap images.

Vector images are creating by placing the point on the grid and drawing line between those point. A color then be add ‚Äúfill in‚Äù the line that have been create.

The advantage of the creating line drawing vector format is that we can increase the dimension of the images without affect the quality of the images.

The current method of using the vector format for display the vector images to the website involving saving the bitmap version of the original images and using that.

The Scalable Vector Graphic ( SVG ) is a new relatively format use for display the vector images directly to the web ( without the need create of bitmap version of them ) however it use it not yet widespread.

Animated GIFS

Animate GIFs show several frame of the images therefor it can be used to create a simple animation.

Above images is a individual frame that make up of an Animate GIFs that show a orange dot resolving around the circle. it‚Äôs like a kind of animation that you might see on the webpage that are still loading.

Most editing images application such as Adobe Photoshop. Allow you to create a Animated GIFs. There are several of tutorial showing how to do it on the web. and also there is a several of website that allow you upload a graphics for a individual frame so it can create a animate GIFs for you.

It‚Äôs important to note that

Each extra frame of the images might be increase the size of the file. and can therefore add to the time it take for the images to download. Most Web - Users usually do not like to wait for the images to download.

Because GIFs are not ideal format for photograph but it only suitable for simple illustration.

Some Designer frown on the GIFs.. Because they remember a lot of most Amateur Web design overusing them in 1990s.

Transparency

Creating the images that is partially Transparent ( See - Through ) for the webpage involving selecting one of these two format

Transparent GIFs

if the transparent part of the images has straight edge and 100% transparent ( no semi-opaque ) you need to save it as a GIFs.

PNG

if the transparent part of the image are , round-edge , diagonal and if you want semi - opaque transparent or a Drop shadow transparent you need to save it as PNG.

PNG transparent are not fully support in older browser. Most notable are internet Explorer 6. There are some JavaScript so you can get the around the issue. The detail of the scripts can be found in tool section of the web site accompany this book.

Examine Images On The Web

<html>
	<body>
		<img src="otto.jpg"
				 alt="2 otto near each other"
				 title="2 otto"
				 height="375"
				 width="500"
	  />	
		 </body>
	</html>

HTML5: Figure and Figure Caption

<figure>

Images are often come with the caption. HTML5 introduce a new <figure> element to contain a images and the caption so these two are associate.

We can have more than 1 of images as long as these images have the same caption.

<figcaption>

<figcaption> was add to HTML5 and in order to allow the web page author add caption to the images

Before these <figure> and <figcaption> were create there no way to associate the <img> element with the caption.

Older browser do not understand the HTML5 element so it simply ignore the HTML5 new element and display content of them 

<html>
	<body>
		<figure>
			<img src    = "images/otto.jpg"
			     alt    = "2 swinmming otto"
			     title  = "2 otto"
			     height = "375"
			     width  = "500" />
			<figcaption> Sea otter hold hands when sleep so they dont drift 
			away from each other. </figcaption>
		<figure>
	</body>
</html>

Example

In this example , the logo is a GIF because it uses flat colors, while the photographs are JPEGs. The main photo is place inside the HTML5 <figure> element and its own caption.

The alt attribute on each images provides a description for those using screen reader and the title attribute provide additional information ( this show in the tooltip when users hover over it )

This example does not use the height , width or align attribute as there being phase out and you are encouraged to use CSS properties instead.

<html>
	<head><title> Example Chapter 5 </title></head>
	<body>
	   <h1><img src    = "images/logo.gif"
	            alt    = "From A to Zuccchini"
	            title  = "Logo"  />
	  </h1>
	  <h2>
	  <figure>
	       <img src    = "images/individualChocolateCakes.jpeg"
	            alt    = "Chocolate Cakes"
	            title  = "Individual Chocolate Cakes"  />  
	       <figcaption> This recipe for individual chocolate cakes is so 
	       simple and so delectable </figcaption>
	   </figure>
	  </h2>
	  <h2>
	   More Recipes :
	   </h2>
	   <p>
		   <img  src    = "images/LemonPosset.jpeg"
		         alt    = "Lemon Posset"
		         title  = "Lemon Posset" />
		   <img  src    = "images/RoatedBrusselSprout.jpeg"
		         alt    = "Roasted Brussel Sprout"
		         title  = "Roasted Brussel Sprout" />
		  <img   src    = "imates/ZucchiniCake.jpeg"
		         alt    = "Zucchini Cake"
		         title  = "Zucchini Cake" />
	 </p>
		</body>
	</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER FIVE : IMAGES

CHAPTER SIX : TABLES

There are several type of information that you need to display in grid or a table. For example Sport result , Stock report and train timetable.

When represent a information in a grid or a table. We need to think in term of gride that make up of rows and column( a bit same of the spreadsheet ) . In this chapter you will learn :

  • Use four key element for creating a table
  • Represent a complex data using a table
  • Add caption to a table

What‚Äôs A Table ?

A table represent information in a grid format. For example this include Financial report , Sport result and TV schedule.

Grid allow you to understand complex data by reference information on 2 axes.

Each block in the grid is refer to as table cell. In HTML table is written row by row.

Basic Table Structure

<table>

We use the <table> element to create a table. The content within the <table> element are written row by row.

<tr>

To indicate the start of the row we need to use the <tr> element which is stand for table row.

It‚Äôs follow by one or more <td> element one for each cell in that row.

To indicate the end of the row we need to use the closing </tr> element tag.

<td>

Each cell of the table will represent using <td> element. Which is stand for table data.

To indicate the end of the each cell we need to use the closing </td>.

Some Browser will automatically draw line in the table and / or in individual cell. You will learn how to control the border using CSS on future lesson

<html>
	<body>
		<table>
			<tr> 
				<td> 1 </td>
				<td> 2 </td>
				<td> 3 </td>
			</tr>
			<tr> 
			  <td> 4 </td>
			  <td> 5 </td>
			  <td> 6 </td>
			</tr>
		  <tr>
		    <td> 7 </td>
		    <td> 8 </td>
		    <td> 9 </td>
		  </tr>
		</table>
	</body>
</html>

Table Heading

<th>

The <th> element use the same as <td> but it purpose to represent a heading for either column or a row. Which is stand for Table heading.

Even if you cell got no content we need to use <td> or <th> element to represent presence of empty cell otherwise it will not render correctly. The first cell in the first line for the example below show the empty cells.

Using <th> element for element help people who use the screen reader software and also improve the ability of search engine index your page and also enable you to control the appearance of the table better when you start to use CSS.

You can use the scope attribute to indicate it‚Äôs the heading for column or it‚Äôs the heading for the rows. This attribute got 2 value column and rows if the value is a row we indicate that heading is for row and if the value is column we indicate that heading is for the column.

Browser often display the content within the <th> element in both and in the middle of the cells.

<html>
	<body>
		<table>
		  <tr>
			  <th></th>
			  <th scope = "column"> Saturday </th>
			  <th scope = "column"> Sunday   </th>
			</tr>
			<tr>
			   <th scope = "rows"> Tickest sold : </th>
			   <td> 120 </td>
			   <td> 135 </td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
			   <th scope = "rows"> Total sales : </th>
			   <td> $600 </td>
			   <td> $675 </td>
			</tr>
		</table>
	</body>
</html>

Spanning Columns

Sometime you may need to entries in the table to starched across more than one column.

colspan

The colspan attribute can be use with either <th> or <td> element to indicate how many column the table cell should run across.

In the example below you can see a timetable with five column. The first column contain a heading for that row ( The day ). The remaining four represent a one hour slot.

If you look at the table cell that contain a word ‚ÄúGeography‚Äù which using a colspan attribute with a value 2 it‚Äôs indicate that that table cell should be run across 2 column. The third row the table that contain the word ‚ÄúGym‚Äù use colspan attribute with a value 3 which indicate that table cell should run across 3 column.

And as you can see the second and third rows have a fewer <td> element than that are in column and that because when the cell is extend more than one column. The <td> or <th> element that should been place in that wider cell will not include in the code.

This is chapter the author add some CSS style to show how the cell span across the column.

<html>
	<body>
		<table>
		   <tr>
			   <th scope = "column"></th>
			   <th scope = "column">9am</th>
			   <th scope = "column">10am</th>
			   <th scope = "column">11am</th>
			   <th scope = "column">12am</th>
			 </tr>
			 <tr>
			   <th scope = "row"> Monday </th>
			   <td colspan = "2"> Geography </td>
			   <td> Math </td>
			   <td> Art </td>
			 </tr>
			 <tr>
			   <th scope = "row"> Tuesday </th>
			   <td colspan = "3"> Gym </td>
			   <td> Home Ec </td>
			  </tr>
			 </table>
			</body>
		</html>

Spanning Rows

Sometime you also need the entries in the table to starched down across more than one rows.

rowspan

The rowspan attribute can use on either <td> or <th> to indicate how many row a cell should span down the table.

In the example below as you can see ABC are showing the Movie from 6pm - 8pm whereas BCC and CNN channel both are also showing the program during this time period ( each of which last one hour ).

If you look at the last <tr> element there is only three element even though there is 4 column in the result below and that because the first <tr> which contain a movie use a rowspan attribute to starched down and take over the below <tr> element.

<html>
	<body>
		<table>
			<tr>
				<th scope = "column"> ABC </th>
				<th scope = "column"> BBC </th>
				<th scope = "column"> CNN </th>
			</tr>
		  <tr> 
		     <th scope = "row"> 6pm - 7pm </th>
		     <td rowspan = "2"> Movie </td>
		     <td> comedy </td>
		     <td> News </td>
		  </tr>
		  <tr>
		     <th scope = "row"> 7pm - 8pm </th>
		     <td> sport </td>
		     <td> Current Affairs </td>
		  </tr>
	</table>
</body>
</html>

Long Tables

There are three element that help distinguish between the main content of the table and the first and last rows ( which can contain different content ).

These element help people who use the screen reader software and also allow you to style these section in different manner than the rest of the table. ( You will see when we start learning CSS in the future chapter ).

<thead>

The heading of the table should be place within this <thead> element.

<tbody>

The body of the table should be place within this <tbody> element.

<tfoot>

The footer of the table should be place with in this <tfoot> element.

By default browser rarely treat the content within these element any differently from other element. But Designer often use the CSS style to change the appearence.

Some HTML editor that come in content management system offer a tool to help you draw a table. if the first row in your table only contain a <th> element these editor will insert the <thead> automatically.

Part of the reason that the <thead> and <tfoot> element have to be separate that is because if our table is longer than a screen ( or if it print it longer than one page ) by having these two element separate so that browser can keep these two element visible while the content of the table scroll. This is also intended to make it easier for the users to see which column data is in ( How ever these functionality is not implemented by default current browser ).

<html>
	<body>
		<table>
			<thead>
			   <tr>
						<th scope = "Column"> Date </th>
						<th scope = "Column"> Income </th>
						<th scope = "Column"> Expenditure </th>
					</tr>
			</thead>
		  <tbody>
			   <tr>
				    <th scope = "row"> 1st January </th>
				    <td> 250 </td>
				    <td> 36 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				    <th scope = "row"> 2nd January </th>
				    <td> 285 </td>
				    <td> 48 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				    <th scope = "row"> 3rd January </th>
				    <td> 260 </td>
				    <td> 42 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
					   <th scope = "row"> 4th January </th>
					   <td> 290 </td>
					   <td> 38 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 5th January </th>
				     <td> 310 </td>
				     <td> 115 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 6th Januray </th>
				     <td> 168 </td>
				     <td> 14 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 7th January </th>
				     <td> 226 </td>
				     <td> 20 </td>
				 <tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 8th January </th>
				     <td> 253 </td>
				     <td> 20 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 9th January </th>
				     <td> 294 </td>
				     <td> 33 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 10th January </th>
				     <td> 216 </td>
				     <td> 46 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 11th January </th>
				     <td> 244 </td>
				     <td> 29 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 12th January </th>
				     <td> 297 </td>
				     <td> 46 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 13th January </th>
				     <td> 328 </td>
				     <td> 86 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 14th January </th>
				     <td> 215 </td>
				     <td> 38 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
						 <th scope = "row"> 15th January </th>
