						 <td> 254 </td>
						 <td> 30 </td>
			   </tr>
			   <tr>
			       <th scope = "row"> 16th January </th>
			       <td> 256 </td>
			       <td> 27 </td>
			   </tr>
			   <tr>
					   <th scope = "row"> 17th January </th>
					   <td> 311 </td>
					   <td> 68 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 18th January </th>
				     <td> 212 </td>
				     <td> 39 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 19th January </th>
				     <td> 234 </td>
				     <td> 36 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				     <th scope = "row"> 20th January </th>
				     <td> 221 </td>
				     <td> 43 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
				      <th scope = "row"> 21st January </th>
				      <td> 259 </td>
				      <td> 38 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr>
							 <th scope = "row"> 22nd January </th>
							 <td> 246 </td>
							 <td> 31 </td>
			   </tr>
			   <tr>
					     <th scope = "row"> 23rd January </th>
					     <td> 248 </td>
					     <td> 17 </td>
				 </tr>
				 <tr> 
						   <th scope = "row"> 24th January </th>
						   <td> 229 </td>
						   <td> 45 </td>
			   </tr>
			   <tr>
			         <th scope = "row"> 25th January </th>
			         <td> 263 </td>
			         <td> 34 </td>
			    </tr>
			    <tr>
			         <th scope = "row"> 26thh January </th>
			         <td> 258 </td>
			         <td> 41 </td>
			    </tr>
			    <tr>
			         <th scope = "row"> 27th January </th>
			         <td> 283 </td>
			         <td> 22 </td>
			    </tr>
			    <tr>
			         <th scope = "row"> 28th January </th>
			         <td> 256 </td>
			         <td> 30 </td>
			    </tr>
			    <tr>
			         <th scope = "row"> 29th January </th>
			         <td> 278 </td>
			         <td> 47 </td>
			    </tr>
			    <tr>
					    <th scope = "row"> 30th January </th>
					    <td> 251 </td>
					    <td> 15 </td>
					</tr>
					<tr>
					    <th scope = "row"> 31st January </th>
					    <td> 129 </td>
					    <td> 64 </td>
				  </tr>
			</tbody>
			<tfoot>
				<tr>
				  <th scope = "row"></th>
				  <td> 7824 </td>
				  <td> 1241 </td>
				</tr>
			</tfoot>
	 </table>
	</body>
</html>

Old Code Width & Spacing

There are some outdate attribute that you may however come across when you look at the older code. So The author mention them here. All of these attribute have been replace by the use of CSS.

width

The width attribute that use on the opening tag of the table indicate how wider the table should be if the <td> or <th> element width are beyond the width that use in the <table> that width use with in <td> or <th> will not allow to go further that the width <table> that have been specify. The width attribute that use on the opening tag of the <td> or <th> tag to specify the width of the individual cells. The value of these attribute is the width for table cells or individual cell in pixels.

The column in the table should form a straight line. So you often see the width attribute on the first row so that ( other subsequent rows will follow the first row setting ).

cellpadding

The <table> tag can be use with the cellpadding attribute to add space inside the cells.

cellspacing

The <table> tag can be use with the cellspacing attribute to add space between each cells.

The value of these attribute is a given pixels.

<html>
	<body>
		<table width       = "400"  
		       cellpadding = "10"
		       cellspacing = "5" >
		       <tr>
		       <th scope = "column"></th>
		       <th scope = "column"
		           width = "150"> Withdrawn </th>
		       <th scope = "column"> Credit </th>
		       <th scope = "column"
		           width = "150"> Balance </th>
		       </tr>
		       <tr>
		       <th scope = "row"> January </th>
		       <td> 250.00 </td>
		       <td> 660.50 </td>
		       <td> 410.50 </td>
		       </tr>
		       <tr>
		       <th scope = "row"> February </th>
		       <td> 135.55 </td>
		       <td> 895.20 </td>
		       <td> 1170.15 </td>
					 </tr>
    </table>
  </body>
</html>

Old Code: Border & Background

border

The border attribute can be use with both <td> and <th> element to indicate the width of the border in pixel.

bgcolor

The bgcolor attribute can be use to indicate the background of the table cell or a individual cells. The value of this attribute often a hex code.

This example is use the HTML with a border and bgcolor attribute no CSS attribute utilized in this example.

When writing a new website it‚Äôs best practice to use The CSS to take control and changing the appearence of the table. rather then this attribute we discuss here that because you will come across when you look at the older website.

<html>
	<body>
		<table border       = "2"
		       width        = "400"
		       cellpadding  = "10"
		       cellspacing  = "5"
		       bgcolor      = "Ff0000" >
		       <tr>
		         <th scope = "column"></th>
		         <th scope = "column"
		             width = "150"> Withdrawn </th>
		         <th scope = "column"
		             width = "0"> Credit </th>
		         <th scope   = "column"
		             bgcolor = "FFFFFF"
		             width   = "150"> Balance </th>
		      </tr>
		      <tr>
		        <th scope = "row"> January </th>
		        <td> 250.00 </td>
		        <td> 660.50 </td>
		        <td bgcolor = "FFFFFF"> 410.50 </td>
		      </tr>
		      <tr>
		         <th scope = "row"> February </th>
		         <td> 135.55 </td>
		         <td> 865.20 </td>
		         <td bgcolor = "FFFFFF"> 1170.15 </td>
		     </tr>
		 </table>
  </body>
</html>

Example Tables

This example shows a table for customers to compare website hosting packages. There are table headings in the first row and first column of the table.

The empty cell in the top left still has a <th> element to represent it. Each cell of the table must be accounted for by a <th> or <td> element. The <th> element use the scope attribute to indicate whether they are heading for a row or column. The final row uses the colspan attribute to spread across all three column.

<html>
	<head>
		<title> Example Table </title>
	</head>
<body>
	<table>
		<thead>
			<tr>
				<th scope = "column"> </th>
				<th scope = "column"> Home starter hosting </th>
				<th scope = "column"> Premium business hosting </th>
			</tr>
			<tbody>
			 <tr>
			  <th scope = "row"> Disk space </th>
			  <td> 250 mb </td>
			  <td> 1gb </td>
			 </tr>
			 <tr>
			  <th scope = "row"> Bandwidth </th>
			  <td> 5gb per month </td>
			  <td> 50gb per month </td>
			 </tr>
			 <tr>
			  <th scope = "row"> Email accounts </th>
			  <td> 3 </td>
			  <td> 10 </td>
			  </tr>
			 <tr>
			  <th scope = "row"> Server </th>
			  <td> shared </td>
			  <td> VPS </td>
			 </tr>
			 <tr>
			  <th scope = "row"> Support </th>
			  <td> Email </td>
			  <td> Telephone and email </td>
			 </tr>
			 <tr>
				 <th scope = "row"> Setup </th>
				 <td> Free </td>
				 <td> Free </td>
			</tr>
			 <tr>
			    <th scope = "row"> FTP accounts </th>
			    <td> 1  </td>
			    <td> 5 </td>
			 </tr>
			 </tbody>
			 <tfoot>
			   <th scope = "row"> </th>
			   <td colspan = "2"> Sign up now and save 10 % ! </td>
			 </tfoot>
			</table>
		</body>
	</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER SIX : TABLES

CHAPTER SEVEN : FORMS

Traditionally The Term ‚ÄúForms‚Äù refer to a print document that contain a space for you to fill in a information.

HTML borrow the concept of forms to refer to different element that allow you to collecting the data from the visitor that visit your site.

Weather you are adding a simple search box to your site or you are create a more complicated insurance application. HTML form give you a set of the element for you to collect the data from the users. In this chapter you will learn :

  • How to add forms to your site
  • Learn about different tool to collect data from the users
  • New HTML5 Form Control

Why Forms?

The best know web on the website is probably The Search box that sit right in the middle of The google homepage.

In addition it enabling user to search . Form also allow user to perform some other function online. You may see form when you registering member on the website. When you are shopping online and when you are signing up for newsletter or mailing lists.

Form Controls

There are several of Form control that allow you to use to collect information from the visitor that visit your site.

Adding Text
  • Text Input ( Single Line ) : Use for a single line of text such as Email address , name .
  • Password Input : Use for a single line of text but it masked all of the character.
  • Text area ( Multi Line ) : Use for Longer area of text ( Message , Comment ).
Making Choice
  • Radio Box : When the user must select one of the number of option.
  • Check Box : When user can select or unselect one or more option.
  • Drop Down Box : When the user must select one of the number of option in the list.
Submitting Form
  • Submit button : Allow you to submit a data from a form to another webpage .
  • Image button : Similar like a Submit button but they allow you to use the images
File Uploading
  • File Uploading : Allow User to upload a file to a website.

How Form Work

  1. Users fill in the form and press the button to submit the information to the server.
  1. The name of Form Control is sent to the Server along with the value of the user enter or selected.
  1. The server processes the information using the programming language C# , V8.net , PHP or Java. It may store the information in the Database.
  1. The Server create a new page and sent back to the browser base on the information receive.

A Form may have different Form control. Each gathering different information. Server need to know which piece of input data that corresponding with which form element.

To differentiate between the various piece of input data. Information that sent from the browser to the server are using name/value pair. In this example the form are asking for the visitor username and also their favorite jazz music. The Form that sent from the browser to the server are :

If the form control allow user to enter the text. so the value of that form control is whatever use enter.

If the form control allow user only choose the fixed answer for example radio box , checkbox , drop down list. Web page author will add code that give each option a automatic value.

You Should not change the name of the form control unless you know the code on the Server will understand the new value.

Form Structure

<form>

From control should live inside these <form> element. This element ( <form> ) should always carry a action attribute and usually a method attribute and id attribute too.

action

Every <from> element require a action attribute. The value of the action attribute is a URL ( Uniform Resources Locator ) to a page on the server that receive the information in the form when it submit.

method

Form can be sent using one of these two method get or post

With the get method the value from the form are add in the end of the URL ( Uniform Resources Locator ) that specify in the action attribute. The get method is ideal for

  • Short form ( search box .. )
  • When you just retrieve data from the server ( Not sending information that should be add or delete in the Data base ) .

With the post method the value are sent in what are known as HTTP header. The rule of thumb of using this method when your form

  • Need to upload a file
  • Very long
  • That contain a sensitive information ( password )
  • add information or delete information from the data base.

If the method attribute is not specific meaning it no exist. The form are sent using the get method

id

We will look on this attribute on future chapter. The value of the id attribute is use to identify form distinctly from other element on the page. and it also use with other by script such as that have to check you have enter a information in the field that require the value.

<html>
	<body>
		<form  action = "example/store.html"
		       method = "get">
		       <p> This is where the form control will appear. </p>
		     </form>
		</body>
</html>

Text Input

<input>

<input> element are use to create a several different form control. And the value of the type attribute will be the one that indicate what kind of input they will be create.

type = ‚Äútext‚Äù

As you know the value of the Type attribute will be determine what kind of input they will create. And if the value of the type attribute is a text meaning that it will create a single line of text input.

name

When user enter an information into a form. Server may need to know which form control each piece of data enter into. For example In the login form the server need to know what has enter as a username and what are given as a password ). Therefore form control need a name attribute. Value of the name attribute will be the one that identify the form control and also it will be sent along with the information they enter to the server.

maxlength

We use the maxlength attribute to limit the number of the character the user may enter. The value of the maxlength attribute is the number of the character user may enter. For example you want them to enter ‚Äúfood‚Äù. since ‚Äúfood‚Äù contain 4 character. So the value of the maxlength will be 4.

size

The size attribute should not be use in the new form. It use in older form to indicate the width of the input text ( Measure by the number of character that would be seen ).

For example the value of the size attribute of 3 meaning that it will create a box wider enough that should display Three character. ( Although users can enter many character if they desired ).

In any new form you write. CSS should be the one that control the form element. The size attribute is mention here and that we cause you might come across of it when you look at the older code. 

<html>
	<body>
		<form action           = "example/store.html"
		      method           = "get">
		     <p> Usersname  : </p>
		      <input type      = "text"
		             name      = "Username"
		             maxlength = "100" 
		             size      = "5" />
		     </form>
		  </body>
</html>

Password Input

<input>

type = ‚Äúpassword‚Äù

As you know the value of the type attribute is use to determine which input should be create. type attribute with the value ‚Äúpassword‚Äù. It will create a text box just like a single line of text input except the character are block out. They are hidden so that if someone is looking at the user screen over the user shoulder they can see the sensitive data such as password.

name

The name attributes is use to indicate the name of the password input and the value of the name are the one the identifier of the form control and these attribute will be sent to the server along with information ( password ) the users have enter .

size and maxlength

This element can carry size and maxlength with the type attribute the value of ‚Äúpassword‚Äù the same as the type attribute the value of ‚Äútext‚Äù meaning that the size attribute will be the one that indicate the width of the text input( measure by the character that would be seen ) and maxlength will be the one that limited the character the users may enter in the text field the value of that attribute will be number of the character the user may enter.

Although the password is hidden on the screen but does not mean the data of the password control are sent securely to the server. You should not use these for sending sensitive information such as credit card number. For full security the server need to be set up to communicate with the users browser using the Secure Sockets Layer ( SSL ). SSL are beyond the scope of this book there are the link to learn more that author leave in the website that accompany this book. 

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = http//www.example.com/login.php 
		      method = "get">
		<p> Users name <input type      = "text"
		                      size      = "5" 
		                      maxlength = "100"
		                      name      = "username"></p>
	  <p> Password   <input type      = "password"
	                        size      = "5"
	                        maxlength = "100"
	                        name      = "password"></p>
		 </form>
	</body>
</html>

Text Area

<textarea>

<textarea> element are use to create a multi-line of text input. Unlike other <input> element <textarea> element therefore must consist with the opening tags and the closing tags of the <textarea> element.

The content that sit between these element will be appear on the text box area when the page is load.

If the user does not the delete the information that is the content of the <textarea> element that appear in the text area box. That information will be sent along with the information whatever the users have type. Some site use JavaScript to clear the information when users click in the text area.

If you create a new form you should use CSS to control the width and height of these element. But in the older code you often come across col attribute and row attribute are using with this element.

The cols attribute are use to indicate how wide the text box are should be( measure by the number of the character ) . The rows attribute indicate how many row the text area should take up vertically.

<html>
	<body>
			 <form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
						 method = "get">
				<p> Text area </p>
					<textarea cols  = "5"
									  rows  = "5"
										name = "comment"> Enter here </textarea>
		  </form>
	 </body>
</html>

Radio Button

<input>

<type = ‚Äúradio‚Äù>

type attribute with the value of radio is a Radio button meaning that it allow the user must to pick just one of the number of the option.

name

The name attribute is sent to the server with the value of the option the user selected. When the question provide for the user for answer in the form of the radio box. The value of the name attribute should be the same for all the radio button that use to answer the question.

value

The value attribute indicate the value is sent to the server for the selected options. The value for each of the button in the group should be different. ( So the server know which option the user has selected ).

checked

The checked attribute is use to indicate which value ( if any ) should be selected when the page is load. The value of this attribute is check. Only one in the radio button group should use this option. 

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https:/www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "get">
					<p> Please selection your favorite genre : 
					<br>
					<input type  = "radio"
								 checked = "check"
								 name  = "genre"
								 value = "Rock"/> Rock
			    <input type  = "radio"
							   name  = "genre"
							   value = "Pop"/> Pop 
					<input type  = "radio"
							   name  = "genre"
								 value = "Jazz"/> Jazz
				 </p>
	  </form>
	</body>
</html>

Checkbox

<input>

<type = ‚Äúcheckbox‚Äù>

Type attribute with the value of check box meaning it allow users to select or deselect one or more options in answer to question.

name

The name attribute is sent to the server with the value the Option(s) user selected When the question is provide for user with the option for answer in the form of checkbox. The value of the name attribute must be all the same for all the button that use to answer the question.

value

The value attribute indicate the value is sent to the server for checkbox checked. The value of the option should be different so the server know which option has user selected ).

checked

checked attribute indicate that which value should be selected when the page is load. The value of these attribute is check.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.con/login.php"
					method = "get">
		<p> Please select your favorite music service(s) : 
		<input type  = "checkbox"
					 name  = "music"
					 checked = "check"
					 value = "iTunes" /> iTunes
	  <input type  = "checkbox"
				   name  = "music"
				   value = "Last.fm"> Last.fm
	  <input type  = "checkbox"
					 name  = "music"
					 value = "spotify"> Spotify 
				</p>
		</form>
	</body>
</html>

Drop Down List Box

<select>

A drop down list ( Also known as Select box ) allow user to select one option from the drop down list.

The <select> element is use to create a drop down list and also it must contain one or more <option> element.

name

The name attribute indicate that the name is sent to the server with the value the user selected.

<option>

The <option> element is use to specify the option that the user can select from. The content that sit between this <option> element will be shown to the users in the drop down list.

value

The <option> element can use with the value attribute and the value attribute indicate that the value is sent to the server with then name of the control if the option user selected.

selected

The selected attribute indicate which option should be selected when the page is load the value of this attribute should be selected. Only one of the option in the Drop down list box should use these attribute.

If this selected attribute is not use the first option will be appear on the top when the page is load. If users doesn‚Äôt select any option that first option will be sent to the server along with the value of the control.

The function of the drop down list box is similar to the radio button ( meaning that only option can be selected ) There are two key factor in choosing which to use :

  • If the User need to see the option at one glance The radio button are better suit
  • If there is a very long list of option ( a list of the country in the world ) Drop down list box are better use.
<html>
	<body>
		<form action       = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method       = "get">
			<p> Your favorite music </p>
			<select name     = "music">
				<option value  = "jazz"
							selected = "selected"> Jazz </option>
			  <option value  = "hip-hop"> Hip-Hop </option>
				<option value  = "Rap"> Rap </option>
			</select>
		<form>
	</body>
</html>

Multiple Select Box

<select>

size

You can turn the drop down select box into box that show more than one options by adding the size attribute. The value of this attribute is the number of the option that should be shown in the box at once.

Unfortunately The browser implemented this is not perfect and should be test thoroughly if used. ( in particular Firefox and safari on mac ).

multiple

You can allow the user to select more than one option in the list by adding multiple attribute. The value of this attribute should be Multiple.

It‚Äôs good idea to tell the users that you can select more than one option. And also it‚Äôs very helpful to tell the user how to use the shortcut as well for normal PC the user should hold down CTRL and select the option more than one and On Mac users should use the command key to select the option.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "get">
		<p> Your Favorite Music Genre ( You can Choose More than One ) </p>
		<select size     = "2"
						multiple = "multiple">
		<option value    = "jazz"
						selected = "selected"> Jazz </option>
	  <option value    = "R&B"
					  selected = "selected"> R&B </option>
	  <option value    = "Rap"> Rap </option>
	  <option value    = "hip-hop"> Hip-Hop </option>
	  </select>
	 </form>
	</body>
</html>

File Input Box

<input>

If you allow the user to upload a file for example images , video , mp3 , pdf. You should use a file input.

type = ‚Äúfile‚Äù

This input type create a box just like a text input but follow by the browse button. When the user click on that browse button. The window opening that allow them to select the file from their computer to be upload to the website.

When you allow user to upload a file the value of the method attribute in the form element should be post method and that because we can not sent a file using a HTTP get method.

When the users click on the browse button. The presentation of the window that allow them to browse for the file they want to upload will match the window of the users operating system. You can‚Äôt control the appearence of these window.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login"
				  method = "post">
		<p> Upload a file please 
		<input type = "file"
					 name = "file">
		</p>
	  </form>
	</body>
</html>

Submit Button

<input>

<type = ‚Äúsubmit‚Äù>

This create a button that sent the form to the server ( when click ) .

name

This can be use with the name attribute or no need to use this attribute.

value

The value attribute is use to control the text and appear on the button. It‚Äôs the best practice to specify the word you want them to appear on the button because the default value of this attribute on some browser is ‚Äúsubmit query‚Äù that might not be appropriate for all kind of form.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action  = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method  = "post">
		<p> Please click subscribe <input type  = "submit"
																			name  = "subscribe"
																			value = "subscribe"> </p>
		</form>
	</body>
</html>

Image Button

<input>

<type = ‚Äúimage‚Äù>

If you want to use the image for a submit button the value of the type attribute should be img. The alt , height , width , src attribute they do the same as the <img> element that we learn on previous previous chapter.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action    = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method    = "post">
		  <input type   = "image"
						 src    = "images/asaprocky.jpg"
						 alt    = "Asap Rocky"
						 width  = "100"
						 height = "100" />
		</from>
	</body>
</html>

Button And Hidden Controls

<button>

The <button> element was introduce to allow user take control how the button appear. And allow other element appear inside the button.

This mean that we could combine the text and the image between the opening tag <button> and the closing </button> tag.

<input>

<type = ‚Äúhidden‚Äù>

The example down below show the form control that are hidden. This form control do not show in the page. Although you can see them when you use view source option in the browser. The webpage author can add the value to that from control that users can not see. For example the webpage author can use this hidden field to indicate which page the users was on when submit the form.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action          = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method          = "post">
			<button><img src    = "imgaes/asaprocky.jpg"
									 alt    = "Asap Rocky"
									 width  = "100"
									 height = "100" /> Add </button>
									 
		  <input type         =  "hidden" 
						 name         =  "bookmark"
						 value        =  "spotify" />
		</form>
	</body>
</html>

Labelling Form Controls

<label>

When introducing to from control we kept the code simple by indicating the purpose for each one in text next to it. However each form control need it own <label> element so that it can make the form control is accessible to vision impair users.

The <label> element can be use in two ways. It can :

  1. It can wrap around both the text description and the control form ( as shown in the example below ) .
  1. It can kept separate from the form control. and use the for attribute to indicate which form control it is a label for. ( as shown in the radio box example below ).

for

The for attribute state which form control it is label belong for. Note that the radio box below have a id attribute. The value of this id attribute should be uniquely identifier an element different from all other element in the page. Meaning that All element using this id attribute should be have different id attribute value. ( The id attribute will be cover on the future chapter ).

The value of the for attribute match of the id attribute on the form control it is labelling. This technique of using for and id attribute can be use with any of the form control. When <label> element is use with the radio box and select box. The user can click on either the label or a form control to select. The expand clickable area make the form easy to use. The position of the label is place is very important if the users doesn‚Äôt know where to enter the information or what information to enter they are less likely to use the from correctly.

As a rule of them here are the best place to place the label element on the form control

Above The Form Control or To the left of the Form Control

  • Text area
  • Text input
  • Select box
  • File upload

To The Right of the From Control

  • Individual Select Box
  • Individual Radio Box

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login"
					method = "post">
			<label>
				<p> Age: <input type      = "text"
												 size     = "10"
												maxlegnth = "100"
												name      = "age"> <p>
			</label>
			<p>Gender: <input type   = "radio"
												name   = "gender"
												id     = "Female"
												value  = "Female"/>
									<label for   = "Female"> Female </lable>
								  <input type  = "radio"
											    name = "gender"
											    id   = "Male"
											   value = "Male"/>
								  <label for   = "Male"> Male </lable>
			</p>
		</form>
	</body>
</html>

Grouping From Element

<fieldset>

You can group a relate from control altogether inside the <fieldset> element. This is helpful in particular a very long form.

Most browser show the fieldset element a line around edge so show how it‚Äôs related. The appearence of these line can be adjust by using CSS.

<legend>

The <legend> attribute can be use directly after the opening tag <fieldset> to contain a caption which indentify the group of that relate from control ( that have be group together inside the <fieldset> element) .

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "post">
				<fieldset>
					<legend> Contact details </legend>
					<lable>
					<p>Email: </p><input  type      = "text"
												        name      = "email"
												        maxlength = "100"
												        size      = "15"></lable>
					<lable>
					<p>Mobile: </p><input type      = "text"
																name      = "mobile"
																maxlength = "100"
																size      = "15"></lable>
				  <lable>
				  <p>Telephone: </p><input type      = "text"
																	 name      = "telephone"
																	 maxlength = ""100"
																	 size      = "15"><lable>
			</fieldset>
  </form>
 </body>
</html>

HTML5: Form Validation

You probably seen a Form on the web that sent user a message when the form control has been not filled in correctly. This is known as Form Validation.

Traditionally Form Validation are perform using JavaScript ( Which is far beyond the scope of this book ) . But HTML5 has introduce Validation and leaving the work to the browser.

Validation help to ensure the users fill in the information in the form that the server may be able to understand when the form is submitted. Validation the form before the content are sending to the server help :

  • Reduce the amount of work that server has to do
  • Enable the user to see there a problem with the form then if validation were perform on the server.

At the time writing this book only Google and Opera support HTML5 validation. Although other browser are expected to follow. In order to support older browser ( That doesn‚Äôt understand The HTML5 ). The web page author are likely to continue using JavaScript to validation form.

An example Of HTML5 form validation is required attribute. Which can be use with other form element that users expect to be filled in. This HTML5 attribute do not need a value. But in HTML4 all attribute must have a value so some people give the value of this attribute is required.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "post">
				<label>
					<p> Usersname: <input type = "text"
																name = "username"
																maxlength = "100"
																size = "10"
																required = "required" /></p>
				</label>
				<label>
					<p> Password: <input type = "password"
															 name = "password"
															 maxlength = "100"
															 size = "10"
															 required = "required" />
				</label>
				<label>
					<input type = "submit"
								 name = "button" 
								 value = "Submit"/>
				 <label>
				 </p>
		</form>
	</body>
</html>

HTML5: Date Input

<input>

Many form need to gather information such as Date , Email Address , URLs. This has Traditional done by using the text input.

HTML5 Introduce new Form control Standardize The way some information is gather. If the browser doesn‚Äôt recognize that new HTML5 input type they likely treat them as a single line text box.

type = ‚Äúdate‚Äù

If you asking for the user for date input you can use the <input> element with the type attribute and the value of the type attribute should be date so it will create a date input in the browser that support that date input HTML5 new type. The date input can be change across due to different browser. 

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
				  method = "post">
		   <label> Departure date: <input type = "date"
																			name = "date" /> </label>
			 <label><input type = "submit"
										 name = "submit"
										 value = "Submit"></label>		   
	 </form>
	</body>
</html>

HTML5: Email And URL Input

<input>

HTML5 also introduce a input that allow the visitor to enter the email and URLs. Browser that do not support this input it will treat these input as a single line of text box.

type = ‚Äúemail‚Äù

If you want to ask the user about the email address you should you the email input. Browser that support the HTML5 validation check the user has provide information in the correct format of an email address. Smart phone optimized the keyboard to display the key that are more likely to use when entering an email address ( for example @ symbol ) . 

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "post">
				<p> Please Enter the email </p>
				<label><input type = "email"
											name = "email"
											maxlength = "100"
											size = "20" 
											required = "required"/> </label>
		</form>
	</body>
</html>

type = ‚Äúurl‚Äù

The url input will be use when you are asking a user about the URL web page address. Browser that support HTML5 validation check the user has provide the information in the correct format of the URLs. Smart phone optimized the keyboard to display the key that are most likely need when entering information.

<html>
	<body>
		<from action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "post">
		<p> Enter a URL </p>
	  <label><input type = "url"
								  name = "URLs"
								  maxlength = "1000"
								  size = "20"
								  required = "required" />
								  </label>
		   </form>
	  </body>
 </html>

HTML5: Search Box

<input>

If you want to create a single line of text box for a search query. HTML5 provide a special kind of input for that purpose ( Search query ).

type = ‚Äúsearch‚Äù

If you want to create a single line of text box for a search query. HTML5 provide a special kind of search input type.

To create a HTML5 search box you should use a <input> element with the type attribute and the value of that type attribute should be search. Older browser that do not support HTML5 treat that input as a single line of text.

Recent browser add some new feature to improve the usability. For example Safari on Mac add a cross to clear the search text box when the users start entering the information. Safari on mac automatically round the corner on the search input field.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "post" >
		<label><p> This is a search box </p>
		
		<input type = "search"
				   name = "search"
				   maxlength = "1000"
				   size = "100"
				   required = "required"/></label>
			<label><input type = "submit"
										name = "submit"
										value = "Search" /></label>
		</form>
	</body>

placeholder

On any of text input you can use the placeholder attribute. Value of these placeholder attribute will be the text that are shown in search box until the users click on it. Older browser often ignore this attribute.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method =  "post">
				<p> Search : </p>
				<label><input type = "search"
										 placeholder = "Enter keyword"
										 name = "search"
										 maxlength = "100"
										 size = "15"
										 required = "required"><label>
				<label><input type = "submit"
										value = "Search"
										name = "search"><label>
		</form>
	</body>
<html>

Example Forms



This example shows a feedback and newsletter sign-up form. It use a variety of form controls.

The <form> element uses the action attribute to indicate the page that the data is being sent to . Each of the from controls sits inside the <form> element. Different type of form control are suited to collecting different type of data. The <fieldset> element is used to group related questions together. The <label> element indicate the purpose of each form controls.

<html>
	<body>
		<form action = "https://www.example.com/login.php"
					method = "post">
			<fieldset>
				<legend> Your Details: </legend>
				<label> Name: <input type  = "text"
														 name  = "Name"
														 size  = "30"
														 maxlength = "100"
														 required = "required" /></label>
				<br />
				<label> Email: <input type = "email"
													    name = "Email"
													    size = "30"
													    maxlength = "100"
													    required = "required" /><label>
		  </fieldset>
		 </form>
		 <form action = "https://www.example.com/form.php"
					 method = "post">
		  <fieldset>
		  <legend> Your Review: </legend>
		  <br />
		  <label><p> How did you hear about us? <select name = "platform">
		  <option value = "google" selected = "selected"> Google </option>
		  <option	value = "friend"> Friend </option>
		  <option value = "advert"> Advert </option>
		  <option value = "other"> Other </option></select>
		  <br />
		  <p> Would you visit agian? </p>
		  <p>
		  <input type  = "radio"
		         value = "yes"
		         name  = "visitoption"
		         id = "yes"><label for = "yes"> Yes </label>
		  <input type	 = "radio"
					   value = "no"
					   name  = "visitoption"
					   id = "no"><label for = "no"> No </label>
		  <input type  = "radio"
				     value = "other"
				     name  = "visitoption"
				     id = "other"><label for = "other"> Other </label>
		 </p>
		 <p> Comment </p>
		 <textarea name  = "comment"
					 cols = "20"
					 rows = "10"></textarea> </p>
		<br />
		<input type = "checkbox"
					  value = "signup"
					  name = "signupoption"
					  id = "signup"><label for = "signup"> Sign me up for email updates </label>
	  <br />
	  </label><input type = "submit"
					 name = "submit option"
					 value = "Submit review" /></label>	
					</fieldset>
				</form>
		</body>
</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER SEVEN : FORMS

CHAPTER EIGHT : EXTRA MARKUP

At this point we have cover the main tag that fit nicely in to the group and section.

In this chapter we will focus to some helpful topic that not easily group together. You will learn about:

  • The Different version of HTML and How to indicate which version you are using
  • How to add comment to your code
  • Global attribute which is the attribute that can be use with any element Including Class attribute and ID attribute.
  • Element that use to group together part on the page. where no other element is suitable.
  • How to embed page within a page using a iframes
  • How to add information about the webpage using the <meta> element.
  • Adding character such as angle bracket and copyright symbol.

The Evolution of HTML

Since the Web was first create there have been several version of HTML.

Each new version was design to be improvement on the last element ( With the new attribute and element was added , and the older code was removed ) .

There have been several version of each browser that use to view the webpage. Each of which implement a new code. Not all web users. However install the latest browser on their computer does not mean that every one can be able to view all the feature and markup.

When you should be particular aware of the browser that do not supporting certain feature. The author have make some note ( as you see on the HTML5 that introduce in the form chapter and CSS future chapter ) .

HTML4 ( Release 1997 )

With the exception of the few element in HTML5 ( Which we have been highlighted ) . All element that you have seen in this book are available in HTML4.

Although HTML4 have some presentation element to control the appearence of the page. But Author do not recommend using these element. For example <center> element allow you to center the content on page. <font> allow you to control the appearence of the text. <strike> element allow you to put line through the text - which all of these can be achieve the same thing using the CSS instead.

XHTML 1.0 ( Release 2000 )

In 1998 a language XML was publish. Its purpose to allow user to write a new markup language. Since HTML was widely use markup language around that time. It was decide that HTML4 should be reformulated and follow the XML rule and it was rename XHTML. Which mean The webpage author had to follow the new strict rule about writing markup. For example :

  • Every element need a closing tag except the empty element
  • Every deprecate element should no longer be use.
  • All attribute name should be written in lowercase.
  • All attribute should have a value and its value should be place in the double quote.
  • Every element that inside another element should be close in the same element.

This example in the book follow the strict rule of XML. meaning that in this book we have learn about XHTML 1.0 with some of the HTML5.

One of the key benefit of that change XHTML can work with other program that are written to create and process XML document.

It could be use with other data format. Such as Scalable Vector Graphic ( SVG ) that is a graphic language written in XML. MathML ( is use to markup a Mathematical Formula) , CML ( is use to markup a Chemical Formula ) .

In order to help the webpage move to a new syntax two main favor of XHTML 1.0 were create :

  • Strict XHTML 1.0 : The webpage author had to follow the rule to the letter
  • Transition XHTML 1.0: The webpage author can use the presentation element such as <center> element , <form> element .

The Transition version of the XHTML was create to allow the author to continue using the older practice ( with less strict syntax ) and some of the element and attribute that going to be remove in the future version of the HTML.

There was also the third version of the XHTML 1.0 call XHTML 1.0 Frameset which allow the web page author to partition a browser window in to a several frame. each of which hold different HTML page. These day frame is rarely use and are being phrase out.

HTML5 ( Release 2000 )

Webpage author do not need to close all the tag and new element and attribute will be soon introduce. At the time writing this book HTML5 specification had not been complete yet but some major browser maker start implementation some many new feature and some webpage author rapidly adopted to the new markup.

Despite the fact that HTML5 is not yet complete. But you can safety take advantage of the new feature of that language as long as endeavors to ensure that the users with the older browser can view your webpage. ( Although some extra feature may not visible to them ) .

DOCTYPES

Because there been several version of HTML we should start the first web page with a DOCTYPES declaration to tell the browser which HTML version this page is use ( Although the Browser usually display even it‚Äôs not include the DOCTYPES declaration ) We will therefore be including for each of each example for the rest of the box.

As you will see in CSS its box model on page 316. The use of DOCTYPES can also help the browser render the page correctly.

Because XHTML are written in XML you will often sometime see the page that use XHTML strict DOCTYPES start with optional XML declaration where it s use it should be the first thing in the document. There must be nothing before it not even the space.

Comments In HTML

<!-- -->

If you want to use comment in the code that not visible to the users browser window. You can add text between these character :

<!-- comment here -->

It‚Äôs good idea to add comment in the code because no matter how familiar are you with the page at the time you are writing and come back later or Someone else trying to look at your code the comment make it easier to understand.

Although the comment are not visible to the user browser main window but it can view by anyone who look at the source code behind that page.

On a long page you often see the comment that indicate where the section of the page should start and end and pass on note to help anyone looking at the code to understand it.

Comment can be use around the block of code to stop that code displaying in the browser window. Example below you see the email links have been block out.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<title> comment </title>
</head>

<!-- Start of introduction -->

<body>

<h1> Current Exhibition </h1>
<h2> Olafur Eliasson </h2>

<!-- End of Introduction -->

<!-- Start of Main text -->

<p> Olafur Eliasson was born in Copenhagen, Denmark 
in 1967 to Icelandic parents . </p>
<p> He is known for sculptures and large-scale installation art
employing elemental materials such as light, water and air temperature
to enhace the viewr's experience </p>

<!-- End of Main text -->

<!-- 
	<a href = "mailto:arifindepay@gmail.com"> Contact </a> 
 -->

	</body>
</html>

ID Attribute

Every HTML element can carry a id attribute. id attribute is use to uniquely indentify the element from all other element on the page. It value should start with a underscore ( _ ) or letter but not number or character . It‚Äôs important to note that no two element within the same page have the id attribute with the same value. Otherwise that value is no longer unique.

As you will see when you start looking at CSS on the next section given element a unique indentify allow users to style it differently than other instance of the same element on the page. meaning that we have a three paragraph but we want the second one to style different ( All text within the paragraph is uppercase , color text ) . For example you might want to assign one paragraph within the page ( that paragraph containing a Pullquote ) which is style differently than other instance of the same element meaning that that paragraph we one it to style it different than the same element which mean the same other <p> element. In the example below the element with the class attribute and value of that class attribute is Pullquote is made to uppercase using CSS.

This id attribute do not affect the presentation and appearence of the element. It‚Äôs only change the appearence if there is CSS rule indicate what it should be display differently.

If you go and learn more about JavaScript ( A programming language that allow you to add interactivity in the page ). The id attribute can be use and allow the script work with that particular element.

The id attribute is known as a global attribute because it can be use with any HTML element.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" 
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1.0/DTD/xhtml1.0-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head><style type = "text/css"> p#pullquote{ text-transform: uppercase;}
</style>

	<body>
		<!-- Start of main text -->
		
		<p> Water and air. So very Commonplace are these substances, 
		they hardly attract attention- and yet they vouchsafe our very
		existence. </p>
		<p id = "pullquote"> every time i view the sea i feel a calming 
		sense of security, as if visiting my ancestral home; 
		i embaark ona voyage of seeing.</p>
		<p> Mystery of mysteries, water and air are right there before
		us in the sea. </p>
	  
	  <!-- End of main text -->
	  
	 </body>
	</html>

Class Attribute

Every HTML element can carry a class attribute sometime rather an unique indentify one element you want to indentify several element to be style differently from other element within the page. For example you have a paragraph of text that contain information that are important than other text you want to distinguish ( treat better different than other element) that element or you might want to differentiate between link that point to other page on your own site and link that point to the external site.

To do this you can use the class attribute and the value of the class attribute is the text that describe which class it belong to in the example below the class attribute is use on the element <p> which value is Important. meaning it describe the class it belong to which is Important.

The class attribute in any HTML element can share the same value with other element. ( their value is not unique like id attribute ) for example if our <p> have a class attribute and value of that attribute is Important. <h1> and <h2> can also share the same value meaning that <h1> can have the class attribute and their value is also Important (same as <p> ). also applied in <h2> too.

By default using these attribute does not the affect the representation of the element. It only change the appearence if only there are a CSS code that should allow it display differently.

In this example below we applied the CSS( since we want to change the appearence ) to make the the element that use class attribute with value the important make that element to be uppercase and make the element that use the class attribute with value admittance make that element to be color-red.

If you would like to indicate your element can belong to several class that element have class attribute and it‚Äôs value should be describe a class that the users need that element belong to it‚Äôs value should be separate by several class( value) with a space see the example below. 

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1.0/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<style type = "text/css"> .Important{ text-transform: uppercase;}
.Admittance{ color: #FF6666;}</style>
</head>
	<body>
		<p class = "Important"> for a one-year period from november 2010,
		the margugame genichiro-inokuma museum of contemporary art (mimoca)
		will host a cycle of four hiroshi sugimoto exhbitions. </p>
		<p> Each will showcase works by the artist thematically contextualized 
		under the heading "Science," "Architecture," "History" and "Religion" so as 
		to present a comprehensive panorama of the artist's oeuvre. </p>
		<p class = "Important Admittance"> hours: 10:00 - 18:00 ( no addittance after 17:30 ) </p>
	</body>
<html>

Block Elements

Some element will always appear to the start on the new line in the main browser window These is known as Block Elements. For example <p> , <h1> , <li> .

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict//EN" 
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<!-- Start of introduction -->
		<h1> Hiroshi </h1>
		<!-- End of introduction -->
		
		<!-- Start of Main Text -->
		<p> The dates for the ORIGIN OF Art exhibition are as follows: </p>
		<ul>
		  <li> Science: 21 Nov - 20 Feb 2010/11 </li>
		  <li> Artitecture: 6 Mar - 15 May 2011 </li>
		  <li> History: 29 May - 21 Aug 2011 </li>
		  <li> Religion: 28 Aug - 6 Nov 2011 </li>
		</ul>
		<!-- End of Main Text -->
	</body>
</html>

Inline Elements

Some element will always appear to continue on the same the same line and act like as their neighboring element. These is known as Inline Elements. For example <a> , <img> , <em>.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<p> Timed to a single revolution of the planet around the sun
		at a 23.4 degrees tilt that plays out the rhythm of the seasons.
		this <em> Origins of Art cycle </em> is organizzed around four themes
		: <strong> sciencs, architecture, history </strong> 
		and <strong> religion </strong>.
	</body>
</html>

Grouping Text And Elements In A Block

<div>

The <div> element allow you to group the element altogether in one block level box.

For example you might want to create a<div> element to contain certain element for heading ( logo , navigation ) or you might want to create a <div> to contain comment from the visitor ( visit your site ) .

In browser content within the <div> element will appear to the start on new line. But other than that it will not make no different to presentation of the page ( meaning that the content are only start at the new line and work the same like the surrounding text no other meaning or changing the appearence ) .

Using id attribute or class attribute on <div> element however mean that we can create a CSS style to indicate how many space that <div> element should occupy on the screen and also change the appearence of the element that contain within the <div> element.

It‚Äôs make it easier to follow your code if you use <div> element for each of the section on the page. Since there is several element inside the <div> element. It can be helpful to add comment after the closing <div> tag is allow you clearly see which opening <div> tag suppose to correspond to. 

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" 
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml/DTD/xhtml-strict.dtd">
<html>
<body>
	<!-- Start of header -->
	<div id = "header">
		<img src = "images/asaprocky.jpg" title = "AsapRocky" 
		alt = "AsapRocky">
		   <ul>
			   <li><a href = "index.html"> Home </a></li>
			   <li><a href = "index.html"> Biography </a></li>
			   <li><a href = "index.html"> Works </a></li>
			   <li><a href = "index.html"> Contact</a><li>
			 </ul>
			</div>
			<!-- End of Header -->
</body>
</html>

Grouping Text And Elements Inline

<span>

The <span> element act like a inline equivalent to the <div> element ( meaning than <span> element is the same like <div> but it use to group a inline element and doesn‚Äôt appear to the start on the new line it‚Äôs appear to the continue on the same line ). It‚Äôs either to :

  • To contain the section of text when there are no suitable element to differential from its surround text. ( for example <p> Arifin Depay Jr </p> we want to group only Depay which element we should be putting to make it still Arifin Depay Jr what element if we put it like this <p> Arifin <em> Depay </em> Jr </p> it display not want we want it display Arifin Depay Jr We want Arifin Depay Jr so there <span> come in <p> Arifin <span> Depay </span> </p> it‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt affect the presentation of the element on the page unless there is a CSS style rule to indicate .
  • Contain a number of inline element.

The most common reason why people use <span> element is that they are allow to control the appearence of the content of the element inside that <span> element ( since it‚Äôs use to group a inline element ) using CSS style.

You will usually see the id attribute or a class attribute use on the <span> element :

  • To explain the purpose of that <span> element.
  • So that CSS style can applied to that element that have specific value for there attribute. 
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtlm1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
   <style type = "text/css"> 
   .gallery
   {
      text-tranform: uppercase;
   }
   </style>
</head>
<body>
   <p> Anish Kapoor won the Turn Prize in 1991 and exhibited at the 
   <span class = "gallery"> tate modern </span> gallery in London
   in 2003 </p>
 </body>
</html>

Iframes

<iframe>

An Iframes is a little of window that have been cut out into the page. and if you look at that window you will see another page. The term iframes is a abbreviation of inline frames.

One common use of the iframes that you see on various page is that it embed the google map into a page . The content of the iframes can be any of the HTML page it can either in the same sever or somewhere else on the web.

An iframes can create using the Iframes element. There will be few of attribute that you might need to know to use

src

The src attribute is use to specific the URL of the page to show in the frames.

height

The height attribute is use to specific the height of the iframe in pixel.

width

The width attribute is use to specific the width of the iframe in pixel.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<iframe src = "https://map.google.co.uk/maps?q=
		moma+new+york&amp;output=embed"
						height = "100"
						width  = "100"> </iframe>
	</body>
</html>

scrolling

The scroll are not support in HTML5. In HTML4 and XHTML are use to indicate whether the iframes should have a scrolling bar or not. This is important that if the page within the frame is larger than the space that we have been allow using the height and width attribute to specify both the height and width of the iframes. Scrolling bar allow user to move around the frame to see more content. The value of this attribute can take one of these 3 value :

  • yes ( to how the scrolling bar )
  • no ( to hide the scrolling bar )
  • auto ( show the scrolling bar when need )

frameborder

The frameborder are not support in HTML5. In Html4 and XHTML are use to indicate whether the frame should the border or not. The value 0 indicate that there are no border to be shown. The value 1 indicate that there are border to be shown.

seamless

HTML5 support a new attribute called seamless. This seamless attribute can be applied to the iframes element where scrolling bar is not desired ( just like other new HTML5 attribute it got no value to specify ) some web author specify it value to seemless. Older browser might be not support this new attribute.

<!-- HTML4 and XHTML -->
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict/EN" 
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<iframe src = "https://www.googlemap.com/"
						height = "100"
						width  = "100"
						frameborder = "1"
						scrolling = "yes"></iframe>
	</body>
</html>
<!-- HTML5 -->
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
	<body>
		<iframe src = "https://www.googlemap.com"
						height = "100"
						width = "100"
						seamless = "seemless"></iframe>
  </body>
 </html>

Information About Your Page

<meta>

The <meta> element live inside the <head> element and contain information about the webpage.

It‚Äôs not visible to user but it fulfills number of purpose such as tell the search engine about the webpage , who create it , whether or not it‚Äôs time sensitive ( if it‚Äôs time sensitive it can be set expire ).

The <meta> element is a empty element it got no closing tag and carry the attribute to contain information.

The most common attribute are name and content. These attribute tents to use together and these attribute use to specify property of the entire page. The value of the name should be the property you are setting. The value of the content should be value that you want to give to the property you are setting.

In the example down below you can see the <meta> element where the name attribute indicate the intention to specify description of the webpage. The content attribute is where this description is actually specify.

The value of the name attribute it can be anything that you want. but here are the define value that are commonly use :

description

This contain the description of information about the webpage. This description are commonly use by the search engine to understand the webpage what it is about and it should be maximum 155 character. And sometime it is display on the search engine result.

keywords

This contain a list of comma separate words that the users might use search on to find the page. In practice this is no longer has any noticeable effect on how the search engine index the site.

robots

This indicate whether the search engine should add the page to the search result or not. The value noindex can be used if the search engine should not add the page to the search result . The value no follow can be used if the search engine should add the page to the search result but not any page linked to.

The <meta> element can be use with http-equiv and content attribute together in pair and the value of the https-equiv serve different purpose and here the three instance of the value :

author

This define the webpage author

pragma

This prevent the browser from caching the page ( That is storing locally to save time downloading on subsequently visit ) .

expire

Because browser often cache the content in the page you can use the optional expire to indicate when the page should be expire ( The browser no longer caching that page ). Note the data must be specific in the format shown below.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
	<meta name = "description"
				content = "example in notion"/>
	<meta name = "keywords"
				content = "example , notion">
	<meta name = "robots"
				content = "nofollow"/>
	<meta http-equiv = "author"
				content = "Arifin Depay Jr"/>
	<meta http-equiv = "pragma"
	      content = "no-cache"/>
	<meta http-equiv = "expire"
				content = "Fri , 04 Apr 2014 23:59:59 GMT" />
	</head>
</html>

Escape Character

There are some character that are use in reserved by HTML code ( For example Left and right angle bracket ) .

Therefore if you these character to be on your page you need to use what are termed ‚Äúescape‚Äù character ( also known as escape code or entity reference ). For example to write a right angle bracket you can either use &lt: or &#60 and if you want to write ampersand you can either use &amp: or &#38.

There are also a special code that you can use to show a symbol for example Trademark , Copyright , Mathematical Character , Currency Symbol and Punctuation Mark. For example if you want to include a copyright in your page you can either use &copy: or &#196.

When using a escape character it‚Äôs important to check the page on the browser to ensure the correct symbol show up. This is because some font do not support these character so you need to specify different font for these character in the CSS code.

Example Extra Markup

This example start by using a DOCTYPE to indicate that this is an XHTML web page. In the head you can also see the <meta> tag describing the page content. Several element use the id and class attribute to indentify their purpose. The copyright symbol has been added using an escape code. Parts of the page have been grouped using <div> elements, and comments have been added to indicate what the </div> elements are closing. 

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHMTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
 <meta name = "description"
			 content = "box-store"/> 
 <meta name = "keywords"
			 content = "Art, book , shop"/>
 <meta name = "robots"
			 content = "nofollow"/>
 <meta http-equiv = "author"
				content = "Arifin Depay Jr"/>
 <meta http-equiv = "pragma"
			 content = "no-cache"/>
<title> Art Book shop </title>
</head>
<body>
<!-- Start of main text -->
<h1> The Art Book Shop </h1>
<!-- header -->
<div id = "header">
 <ul> 
   <li><a href = "index.html"> home </a></li>
   <li><a href = "index.html"> new publications </a></li>
   <li><a href = "index.html"> contact </a></li>
  </ul>
  <!-- End of header -->
  <p> Charing Cross Road, London, WC2, UK </p>
  <p> Telephone 0207 946 0946 </p>
  <p> Email <a href = "mailto:arifin@gmailcom"> book@example.com </a> </p>
  <iframe src = "https://www.googlemap.com"
		      height = "100"
		      width = "100"
		      scrolling = "no"
		      frameboarder = "0" /><iframe>
	<p> &copy: The Art Bookshop </p>
	<!-- End of main text -->
</body>
</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER EIGHT: EXTRA MARKUP

CHAPTER NINE : Flash , Video And Audio

Flash is a very popular technology to add a animation , music and video to your web page. This chapter begin by looking how use it on your webpage.

Then we focus on how use add video and audio into your webpage and using either the new HTML5 <audio> and <video> element. or Hosted Service ( You tube or SoundCloud ). In This chapter you will learn :

  • How to use Flask on your webpage
  • How to use The new HTML5 <video> and <audio> element.
  • When to host your own video and audio and when you use the hosted service such as you tube or SoundCloud.

How Flash Works

Since 1990s Flash have been very popular for creating an animation and later on for playing video and audio on the website.

Whether you are creating a animation or a media player in flash the file that you put on the webpage are referring to flash movie.

IF you want to create your own flash movie ( meaning that you want to create a animation using and put in website ) you need to purchase The Flash authoring environment from the Adobe.

There are however several of company that offer Flash animation and slideshow as well as the video and audio you can use without purchasing the tools.

When you creating a flash file in The Flash authoring environment that file has been save in FLA format ( which has .fla file extension ). In order to use that file in to the Website it need to be in different format known as SWF. ( which has .swf file extension ).

When you exporting the movie in to SWF format ( meaning that you want to use that in the website ) The flash will create a code so you can use that to embed the flash movie in to your page. Transitionally this code are using with HTML <object> and <embed> tags but now it‚Äôs most commonly use in JavaScript.

To view Flash browser need to use a plugin ( a extra piece of software that are running on the browser ) called Flash player. Statistic indicate that 98% of the browser on most of desktop computer are already having this plugin installed . ( percentage of phone and tablet which is more less ) .

There is no space in the book to explain how to create a flash movie but this chapter will show how to put flash movie in to the site.

Use Of Flash

Since 2005 number of factor meaning that fewer website are written in Flash and even use the element of flash in the webpage.

When flash was first release its develop to create a animation. The technology quickly evolve and people start using it to create a media player also even to create the entire site.

Although The flash are still very popular. In recent year people have been selective when they should use it ( and now it‚Äôs rarely consider use to create the entire site using flash )

Despite that. Flash does not make it to the future web there are somethings that does it very well such as creating animation .

There are several reason that fewer website are still using flash these day including :

  • In 2005 2006 The set of JavaScript software library ( including prototype , script.aculo.us , jQuery ) has been launch. Which make it a lot more easier for people creating animate effect using JavaScript.
  • Apple Launch iPhone in years 2007 and later iPad in 2010 They took the decision not supporting the Flask .

There are been law that introduce to ensure that website should be usable also to those with vision impairment and also the physic impairment. Flash has been criticized because flash content does not support the meet accessibility requirement.

In 2008 Browser supporting HTML5 which is <video> and <audio> tag. but Flash is still popular for playing video and audio on some website. but more and more people are switching to HTML5.

TimeLine Flash, Video And Audio

Adding A Flash Movie To Your Web Page

The most popular way of adding flash in to the webpage is using the JavaScript there are several script that you can use without in depth of understand the JavaScript language.

The script that we looking at here is called SWFobject. You can obtain the copy of it for free from the google. And you see how to use it on the next page.

One advantage of using these technique is that it allow the browser show alternative content to the user that browser are not capable of showing flash.

This technique use <div> element to create space where the flash movie should sit. And the <div> element contain a id attribute that value of that id attribute is use by the SWFobject. In our example the <div> element value of this id attribute is bird.

Inside the <div> element you can add the alternative content for the users whose are not capable of showing flash . ( meaning that this alternative content inside the <div> element will be shown if the browser can not be able to show flash ) .

The SWFobject script will check to see if the users browser can play the flash movie. If it can the <div> whose value is use by the SWFobject is replace by the .swf file.

For user who can not see the flash movie you can show the still for the movie instead. You might also like considering using the text description for the flash file.

If you are using text description as the alternative content you can achieve these two further benefit:

  1. The text can be access by those with vision impairment / physical impairment who are unable to interact with flash movie .
  1. The text can be indexed by search engine ( Which are not effective at indexing the SWF file) increase the chance of the content will be found.

In this example of this SWFobject script that host on the google server. We include the script in the Webpage using the first of the two <script> element.

The type attribute is use on the <script> element indicate that the script inside are written in JavaScript. The src attribute tell the browser where to find the script.

The second <script> element is use to tell the browser about the flash movie. as well as which element will be replace by the flash movie. This <script> element actually telling the SWFobject five piece of information . These include :

  1. The location of the .swf file : flash/bird.swf
  1. Which element should be replace by the .swf file. Specific by the value of the id attribute example above show the <div> element that will be replace by the .swf file value of the id attribute is bird.
  1. The width of the flash movie : 400px
  1. The height of the flash move : 500px
  1. The version of the flash player that need to view the movie : Flash player 8.
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Script//EN" 
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<script type = "text/javascript"
						src  = "https://ajax.googlepls.com/ajax/libs/swfobject/2.2
						/swfobject.js"></script>
		<script type = "text/javascript">swfobject.embedSWF("flash/bird.swf"
		, "bird" ,  "400" , "300" ,  "8.0.0");</script>
	</head>
	<body>
	  <div id = "bird"> An animation of a bird taking a shower </p>
	  </div>
	</body>
</html>

Understand Video Format And Player

To add video to your site there are two key issue to understand here: file format and Video player / plugin.

Format

Movie are available in many format ( DVD, VHS, Blue ray name a few ) . In Online there are even more format including ( AVI , Flash Video , H162, MPEG, OGG Theora, Web M , Window Media , QuickTime ) .

Just as like DVD player it cant play a VHS cassette. Browser differ in video format they do and don‚Äôt support.

In order to let someone view your video online you may need to convert your video to another format.

The process of convert a video to another format is known as Encoding the video.

There are several app available on the web that let you encoding the video

Player/Plugin

Browser were initially design to show images and text only. For this reason Browser that built prior 2010 generally required another program call Player or Plugin to be installed in order to play the video content.

These player and plugin only support certain of video format.

Recently browser evolve to support HTML5 <video> element ( Which render player and plugin outside ) .

Unfortunately However you cant rely on user having recent browser to support HTML5 element. Browser that do recognize <video> element required encoding video to another format.

Approach

The easiest way of video to you site is to use the hosted service such as YouTube , Vimeo ‚Ä¶ etc.

However there are some case when using service is not appropriate ( as you see on the next page ) and you want to host the video to your own site.

At the time the author of writing this. To ensure that most people can play your video content it‚Äôs consider best practice to use HTML5 for those browser who support and Flash video for those who don‚Äôt. meaning that you need to upload a video that you want to show up in two different format Web M and MP4.

Using Hosted Video Service

The easiest way to add video to the site is to add video to the site such as YouTube , Vimeo and use the feature they provide to embed the video in the page.

Advantages

Host video site ( such as YouTube , Vimeo ) provide player that work with the majority of the Web Browser.

You do need to worry about encoding the video since the site allow you to upload the content in the range of format. Once upload they automatically convert into various of format that required by different browser.

Web hosting company often charge extra if you use a lot of bandwidth. and video file can be quite large. Therefor it will cost extra if you host the video in your own site and if you host your video in other site like YouTube or Vimeo you do not need to pay for the bandwidth.

Disadvantages

Your video will be available on the site of hosted Service if you want your video to be exclusive meaning that it not visible to other site, You need to host the video in your own server and you need to add your own player in to the page.

Some service will limited what video is allow to upload. Most prohibit on the use of advertising within the video you upload ( Which prevent you from monetizing the content ).

Some hosted service will play their own advert before your video is begin. and even overlay all over your screen as your video is still playing. The quality of video of some host service can also be limited.

The Alternative

If you want to host the video on your own site rather than other site. A lot of more work involve setting up the site to play the video.

We will be looking at two different way to host the video on both flash video and HTML5 <video> element.

In order to ensure that maximum of visitor that visit your site can see the video we need to use a combination of these technique.

Preparing A Flash Video For Your Site

There are three way that you need to know to add Flash video in your Web Page.

1 . Convert Your Video into FLV format

To play Flash video you may need to convert it to a FLV format. Since Flash 6 The flash authoring environment has come with Flash video encode that allow you to convert your video to a FLV format.

Some flash video player also support a format called H264 ( and some video editing program export the video using these H264 format ) .

Googling FLV and H264 Converter you will find the alternative encoder software.

2 . Find the FLV player to play The video

You‚Äôll need a player that are written in flash to play the FLV video . It‚Äôs purpose is to hold the FLV movie and add control such as play / pause that are two site that offer a FLV player

  • www.osflv.com
  • www.longtailvideo.com

You do not need The flash authoring environment to use either of these on your website.

3 . Include the player and video in the page

You can include the player in the page using the JavaScript technique such as SWFobject. which we are mention in the earlier example introduction of SWFobject .

You will also need to tell the player where is the video that you it to play ( Some player have advance feature such as the ability to create a playlist for multiple video or add the picture still before the video play ).

Adding Flash video in to Your Page

In this example below we use the OS FLV video player to display the video that name are puppy.flv which are already convert in to the FLV format.

You have already seen how to use the SWFobject to embed a basic animation in the page. Some flash movie need a information in order for them to work. In our example You need to tell the player the path to the file that need to be play. The SWFobject use the JavaScript variable to pass the information to the Flash movie. There are provide in a two line of code that start with var:

  • The particular player is not expecting any information from the flashvars. Which are they left empty
  • The path to the movie is supplied in the variable called parem.

The line after the var is the one that tell about the script where to replace the element with the video player as you see on the prior example introducing in SWFobject.

Different video player required information such as the path to the video is slightly different. but they usually come with the example and documentation that help you understand.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<script type = "text/javascript"
						src  = "https:/ajax.appleapis.com/ajax/libs/swfobject/2.2
						/swfobject.js"></script>
		<script type = "text/javascipt">
				var flashvars = {};
				var parems = {movie: "../video/pupply.flv"};
				swfobject.embedSWF("flash/splayer.swf" , "puppy" , "400"
				, "320" , "8.0.0" , flashvars, "parems"); </script>
	<body>
		<div id = "puppy"> Puppy is playing on the snow </div>
	</body>

HTML5: Preparing Video For Your Pages

Despite HTML5 <video> element being recently addition. It‚Äôs enjoying widespread. There are some key issue that you should be aware of.

Support

The new HTML5 only support by recent browser. So you cannot use this technique if you want everyone to be able to see your video you need to combine ( HTML5 and flash video) .

Digital Rights

At the time Author writing this <video> element do not support Digital Rights Management. But dedicated pirate will usually find the way around Digital Rights Management.

Format

Not all browser support video with same format meaning that you need to supply your video in more than format.

To reach as many browser as possible you should provide your video in this following format :

  • H264 : Internet Explorer , Safari
  • Web M : Opera , Chrome , Android , Firefox

Opera , Chrome , Android and Firefox they indicate that they will support a format call Web M ( Some flash player also support H264 and Web M which will save on the number of conversion ).

Controls

The browser supplies it own control for the player ( meaning that you do not need to worry about finding a player or anything ) and these can vary from browser to browser if you need to control the appearing of the control you can use the JavaScript ( which is beyond the scope of these book ) .

In The Browser

One of the problem with most player such as flash player is that they behave inconsistently. When the element such as Menus drop over them or the Window is scaled up and down. HTML5 option solve this all issues.

HTML5: Adding Video to your page

<video>

The <video> element have number of attribute that allow you to control the video playback :

src
