The attribute specify the path to the video ( In our example show below is the specify to the video with a Web M format since we want to display in the Microsoft Edge ) .

poster

This attribute allow you to specify the images you want to show while the video is still downloading or until the user tell the Browser to play the video.

width and height

This attribute allow you to specify the the size of the player in pixels.

controls

When use this attribute indicate that the browser should supply it own control for the playback.

autoplay

When use this attribute indicate that the browser should automatically play the file.

loop

When use this attribute indicate that the browser should start playing the video again once it‚Äôs end.

preload

This attribute tell the browser what to do when the page is load it can take one of these 3 value :

  • none : The Browser should not load the video until the users presses play
  • auto : The Browser should download the video when the page is load
  • metadata : The Browser should only collect information such as size , track list, first frame and duration.

In HTML5 you do not need to supply value to the attribute such as control , loop , and autoplay in this <video> element. These attribute can be represent using the on/off switch. if the attribute is present the option will turn on if the attribute is not present the option will turn off.

If the browser that do not support the <video> element or The Browser do not the video format every content between the <video> element will be display.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<body>
			<video src = "video/gnx.webm"
						 preload = "auto"
						 controls = "controls"
						 autoplay = "autoplay"
						 loop = "loop"
						 width = "100"
						 height = "100"
						 poster = "video/poster/gnx.jpeg"/>
			This is the video of Kendrick Lemar new Video Albums </video>
		</body>
	</html>

HTML5: Multiple Video Sources

<source>

To tell the specific location of the file you can use the <source> empty element inside the <video> element This should replace the src attribute on the opening <video> tag.

You can also use multiple <source> to specify that video is available in different format.

( Due to the bug in IPad4 you need to provide MP4 as the first format otherwise it might not working ) .

src

This attribute is use to specify the path to the video.

type

You should use this attribute to tell the browser which format this video is. Otherwise it will download some video to play the file ( which take more time and bandwidth ) .

codecs

This attribute is use to encode the video supply within the type attribute. Note it use single quote as well as the double quote in the type attribute. when it‚Äôs supply.

If your browser do not support the <video> element or it doesn‚Äôt support the format. Every thing inside the <video> element will be display for the user.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<body>
			<video poster = "video/poster/gnx.jpg"
						 width  = "100"
						 height = "100"
						 loop   = "loop"
						 autoplay = "autoplay"
						 controls = "controls"
						 preload = "auto" >
		   <source src  = "video/gnx.mp4" 
						   type = "video/mp4;codecs = "avc1.42E01E
						   , mp4a.40.2"">
			  <source src = "video/gnx.webm"
							  type = "video/webm;codecs = "vp8 , vorbis"">
		  <p> This video is not avaiable </p>
		  </video>
		 </body>
		</html>

HTML5: Combining Flash & HTML5 Video

By offering you video in both HTML5 and Flash video you will ensure that it can be view by most majority of the users that visit your site.

You should choose offer HTML5 first and Flash video as a fallback for people whose browser that does not support HTML5 video. Or you may work other way around.

Because some video player are build in flash support H264 encoding. If you use the player that support these format you only need to provide the video in these H264 format and Web M format ( You do need to provide FLV format as well ) . You will see it demonstrate in the example at the end of the chapter .

If you start working with HTML5 video in depth you also :

  • Create your own playback control
  • Provide a different version of the video for browser that have different screen sized ( You can provide a lower resolution content for a handheld device ) .
  • Tell the different part of the page to change when the video reach certain point of the video.

Adding Audios To Web Pages

By far the most popular format for putting audio on the Web page is MP3. As with video there are three route commonly taken.

1 . Use the Hosted Service

There are several site that allow you to upload the audio and provide you a player which you can embed in the page. Such as www.soundcloud.com and www.myspace.com .

2 . Use Of Flash

There are several flash movie that allow you to play the MP3. From a simple button that play a single track to a complex player that allow you to create a playlist and juke boxes.

3 . Use Of HTML5

The HTML5 introduce a new <audio> element . Browser that support this <audio> element provide its own control for the player meaning that we no need to worry about finding any player just as like a video file that we look earlier.

Some people ask how to play the MP3 consistency when visitor visit your site moving from one website to another website. This is quite difficult to achieve since we need to reply on technique called AJAX to reload the content or develop the entire using flash. This is why some site offer a MP3 player in winder so the listener are not interrupted when moving between pages.

Adding A Flash MP3 player

There are many MP3 player that written in flash such as

  • flash-mp3-player.net
  • musicplayer.sourceforge.net
  • www.wimpyplayer.net

Each of these player has different functionality you should check their feature before choosing for your site.

This example below use the MP3 player from flash-mp3-player which embed in the page using the SWFobject technique. The player is told to the path of the MP3 file using the parameter called MP3.

After the second opening <script> tag you can see we have create two JavaScript variable the first one name flashvars and the second one name parem. Even thought the first name flashvars do not use ( not expecting any information ) The SWFobject expect it come before the parem variable so we need it here.

The parem will told the player where to find the audio.

These 2 variable were add at the end of the line that embed the MP3 Player. ( Just the end of the second <script> tag ) .

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
	<script type = "text/javascript"
					src = "https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs
					/swfobject/2.2/swfobject.js"></script>
	<script type = "text/javascript">
	var flashvars = {};
	var parems = {mp3: "audio/test-audio.mp3"};
	swfobject.embedSWF(flash/player_mp3_1.0.0.swf , "music-player"
	, "200" , "20" , "8.0.0" , flashvars , parems); </script></head>
<body>
	<div id = "music-player">
		<p> You browser cant display this </p>
  </div>
 </body>
</html>

HTML5: Adding HTML5 Audio To Yours Page

<audio>

The HTML5 introduce the new <audio> element that allow you to include the audio file in the page. As with the HTML5 video Browser expect different format for audio file.

The <audio> element have several attribute that allow you to control the audio playback :

src

This attribute allow you to specify the path to the audio file.

controls

This attribute indicate that weather the player should display the controls . If you do not use this attribute no control will be not shown by default. You can specify your own Controls using the JavaScript.

autoplay

The presence of this attribute indicate that the audio player should start playing the audio automatically ( it‚Äôs consider best practice to let the visitor choose to play ) .

preload

This attribute indicate that what the browser should do when the player is not set to autoplay. It can take one of the three value same as we saw in the <video> element.

loop

This attribute specifies that the audio track should start playing again once it‚Äôs finished.

In this example below we use the mp3 format which support browser Chrome , Safari and Internet Explorer if you want it to work with other browser such as Chrome , Internet Explorer ,, Firefox and Opera you need another format that known as ogg or use the <source> element on the next page.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<audio src = "audio/GNX.mp3"
					 controls = "controls"
					 autoplay = "autoplay"
					 preload = "auto"
					 loop = "loop"> This is GNX audio </audio>
	</body>
</html>

HTML5: Multiple Audio Sources

<source>

It‚Äôs possible to specify more than one audio file using the <source> element that sit between the opening <audio> tag and the closing </audio> tag ( it should be replace the src attribute on the opening <audio> tag ) .

this is really important because different browser support different format for audio files.

  • MP3 : Internet Explorer , Chrome and Safari
  • Ogg Vorbis : Internet Explorer , Chrome , Firefox and Opera

So you would need to specify two audio format to get coverage across the recent browser that do support HTML5 <audio> element. You could also provide a flash alternative for older browser that do not support the HTML5 <audio> element.

The HTML5 <audio> element has not gain as widespread Adoption as <video> element. and these have been issues with the audio quality in the browser first to implement this .

src

<source> element use this src attribute to indicate where is the audio file.

type

At the time of author writing this. Type attribute is not commonly being use in the <source> element at the same way it was for the <video> element. ( meaning that it was not commonly use like in the the video element ) .

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<audio controls = "controls"
					 autoplay = "autoplay"
					 loop = "loop"
					 preload = "auto">
			<source src = "audio/GNX.mp4">
			<source src = "audio/GNX.ogg">
		<p> This audio is not avaiable in your browser </p>
	</audio>
</body>
</html>

Example Flash, Video And Audio

This example uses HTML5 to show a video.

The video has been encoded in H264 and Webm formats to reach as many browser as possible. A Flash player has been added to the page for browsers that do not support HTML5 video. The Flash player is embedded using SWFobject. If the browser does not support HTML5 video or flash, then a plain text message will be shown to the user.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
<head>
	<script type = "text/javascript"
	        src = "https://ajax.googleaspis.com/ajax/libs/swfobject/2.2/swfobject.js">
	      </script>
	  <script type = "text/javascript">
	  var flashvars = {};
	  var parems = {movie: "video/GNX.FLV"};
	  swfobject.embedSWF("flash/osplayer.swf" , "snow" , "300" , "300"
	  , "8.0.0" , flashvars , parems);</script>
	</head>
   <body>
	   <div id = "snow">
		   <video poster = "video/poster/GNX.jpeg"
					    controls = "controls"
					    preload = "auto"
					    width = "500"
					    height = "500"
					    autoplay = "autoplay"
					    loop = "loop">
				<source src = "video/GNX.mp4" 
								type = 'video/mp4; codecs = "avc.1.42E01E , mp4a"'>
			  <source src = "video/GNX.webm"
							  type = 'video/webm; codec = "vp8 , vorbis"'>
					<p> Your browser do not support both HTML5 and FLash </p>
			</div>
		</video>
	</body>
</html>

SUMMARY CHAPTER NINE : Flash Video And Audio

CHAPTER TEN : Introducing CSS

In this section we will look at how to make our web pages look more attractive and controlling the design of them using CSS.

CSS allow you to create rule that specify how the content of the element should be appear. For example you can specify the background of the page is cream. All the paragraph should be appear in Gray with Arial typeface. or that All level one heading should be appear in blue , italics with time typeface.

Once You learn how to write the CSS rules. Learning CSS mostly involve learning different properties so that you can use. In this chapter will

  • Introduce how the CSS work
  • Teach you how to write a CSS rule
  • Show you how to apply CSS rule to HTML page.

The remaining chapter in this section we will look at all of the various CSS different properties you can use .

Understanding CSS: Thinking Inside The Box

The Key to understand how the CSS works is to imagine that there is a invisible box around every HTML element.

On this page you just see a basic HTML page.

But on the other page ( below ) you can see the same basic HTML page but the Author have add a border for each element so that you can see how the CSS treat each element as if it‚Äôs live inside its own box.

Block & Inline Elements

As you remember from page 185 and 186 the different between them and how the browser display them.

Block Elements

Block Element look like they start at the new line For example <h1> .. </h6> , <p> , <table> , <div>.

Inline Elements

Inline Elements Flow within the text and do not start at the new line For example <i> , <a> , <img> , <strong> .

CSS allow you to create rule that control the way that each individual box and the content of that box is present

In this example Block element is shown in the red border and the Inline element shown in green border.

The body element create the first box and the <p> , <h1> , <a> , <i> element . Each create their own box within it.

Using CSS you can create a border around any of the box ( represent by the <p> , <h1> , body, ‚Ä¶element ) by specify its width and height or add a background color. You can control the text inside the box For example size , color , type face .

Example style

Boxes

  • Width and height
  • Background color or images
  • Position in the browser window
  • Border

Text

  • Size
  • Color
  • Typeface
  • Bold , italics , lowercase , uppercase and small-caps

Specific

There also a specific way which you can style a certain of element such as table , form , list.

CSS Associates Style Rules With HTML Elements

CSS work by associating with the HTML elements. These rule govern how the content of the specific element should be display. CSS rule contains two part a selector and a declaration.

This example above the rule indicate that all the <p> element should be display in Arial typeface.

Selector: Indicate the element that the rule should be applied to same rule can applied to more than one element if you separate the element with a commas.

Declaration: Indicate how the element refer to in the Selector should be style Declaration are split into two part A property and a value. that are separate by a colon.

CSS Properties Affect How Elements Are Displayed

CSS declaration are sit inside the curly brackets and is made up of two part a property and a value which separate by a colon. You can specify several property within a one declaration. Each separate by the semicolon.

In the example above the rule indicate that all the h1 , h2 , h3 elements will be display in Arial typeface and in the yellow color.

Property : indicate the aspect of the element you want to change for example you want to change font , size , color , width , height and border .. .

Value : Specify the setting that you want to use for the chosen property meaning that if we have a property we need a value to specify its setting For example if you want to specify the color property the value of that chosen color property will be the color that you want your selector to display .

Example Introducing CSS

Here you can see a simple web page that is style using CSS.

This example uses two documents: the HTML file ( example.html ) and a separate CSS file ( example.css ). The fifth line of HTML uses the <link> elements to indicate where the CSS file is located.

On the next page, you will see how CSS rules can also be placed in your HTML pages and we will discuss when you might want to do this.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head><title> Example Introducting To CSS </title>
				<link href = "CHAPTER10.0.css" 
							type = "text/css" 
							rel  = "stylesheet"/>
	</head>
	<body>
		<h1> From Garden to plate </h1>
		<p> A <em> potager </em> is a french term for an ornamental 
		vegetalable or kitchen garden. Often flowers ( edible and non-edible )
		and herbs are planted with the vegetables to enhance the garden's 
		beauty. The goal is to make the function of providing food aesthetically
		pleasing. </p>
		<h2> What to Plant </h2>
		<p> Plants are chosen as much for their functionality as for their color
		and form. Many are trained to grow upward. A well-designed potager can
		provide food, cut flowers and herbs for the with very little maintenance.
		Potagers can disguise their function of providing for a home in a wide array of 
		forms - from the carefree style of the cottage garden to the formality of 
		a knot garden.</p>
	</body>
	</html> 
p
	{ 
		font-family: Arial;
	}
h1,h2
	{
		font-family: Arial;
		color: Pink;
	}

Using External CSS

<link>

This <link> element can be use inside the HTML document to tell the browser where to find the CSS file that use to style the page. It‚Äôs an empty element meaning that it do not have a closing tag. It‚Äôs should live inside the <head> element and must consist with this 3 attribute.

href

This attribute specify the path to CSS file

type

This attribute specify which type of the document that being link to. The value of this attribute should be text/css when the document is linking to the CSS file.

rel

This attribute specify the relationship between the HTML page and the file that being link to. The value of this attribute should be stylesheet when the file that HTML page is being link to is CSS.

An HTML page can use more than CSS style sheet if you do that you could have a <link> element for every CSS file it use. For example the author may link to the one CSS file ( which use for the presentation ) and author may link to the another CSS file ( which use for the layout ) .

<!DOCTYPE HTML public "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<title> External CSS </title>
		<link href = "CHAPTER10.1.css"
					type = "text/css"
					rel  = "stylesheet"/> </head>
		<body>
			<h1> Potatoes </h1>
			<p> There are dozens of different potato varieties.
					They are usually described as early. Second early
					and maincrop. </p>
	  </body>
	</html>
h1
{
	background-color: white;
}
body
{
	font-family: arial;
	background-color:brown;
}

Using Internal CSS

<style>

You can include The CSS rule inside the HTML page by replace them inside the style element which sit inside the head element of the page.

The <style> element should use the type attribute to indicate that the style are specific in CSS. The value should be text/css if the style are specific in CSS.

When building the site with more than one page you should use the External style sheet This allow :

  • Allow the page should use the same style sheet rule ( rather than repeating each page ) .
  • Keep the content separate from how the page look.
  • Meaning that we could change the style across the page by alter just one CSS file ( rather than for each individual page ) .

In HTML4 and Transitional XHTML you could use the style attribute on most of the element appear in the body of the page. The CSS rule that appear in the value of the attribute would only apply for that one element. We should avoid this attribute in the new site but author mention it here because we will see it when we looking at the older code. This below show the example how to style only a paragraph of text using the <style> attribute.

<p style = "font-family"> Hello World </p>
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XTHML 1.0 Strict"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<title> Internal CSS </title>
		<style type = "text/css">
			h1
			{
				background-color: white;
			}
			body
			{
				font-family: Arial;
				background-color: brown;
			}
	 </style>
	</head>
		<body>
		<h1> Potato </h1>
		<p> There are dozens of different potato varitites.
				They are usually described as early, second early and
				maincrop potatoes. </p>
		</body>
	</html>

CSS Selector

There are many different type of CSS selector that allow you to target rule to a specific element in the HTML document.

The table show on the opposite page introduce the most commonly use of the CSS selector.

On this page There is a HTML file to demonstrate which element these CSS selector would apply to .

CSS selector are case sensitive they must match the name of the of the element and the attribute value exactly.

There are move advance selector that allow you select element base on the attribute and their value which you will see on the later chapter .

Internet Explorer 7 is the first Internet Explorer that support the last two selector are shown in the table ( knowns as sibling selector ) which are less commonly use than all other element show in the table .

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head><title> CSS Selector </title></head>
	<body>
		<h1 id = "top"> Kitchen Garden Calendar </h1>
		<p  id = "introduction"> Here you can read our handy guide about what to do when. </p>
		<h2 class = "note"> Spring </h2>
		<ul>
			<li><a href = "notfound.html"> Spring mulch vegetable beds </a></li>
			<li><a href = "notfound.html"> Plant out early potatoes </a></li>
			<li><a href = "notfound.html"> Sow tomato seeds </a></li>
			<li><a href = "notfound.html"> Sow beet seeds </a></li>
			<li><a href = "notfound.html"> Sow zucchini seeds </a></li>
			<li><a href = "notfound.html"> Deadhead rhubarb flowers </a><li>
	 </ul>
	 <p class = "note"> This page was written by <a href = "mailto: arifindepayjr@gmail.com"> ivy@example.org </a>
			 for <a href = "example.html"> Example </a> . </p>
			<a href = "#top"> Top of page </a>
			</body>
		</html>



Universal Selector

Apply the rule to All of the element in the document.

*
{ }

Targets all of the element on the page.

Type Selector

Match an element with the same name.

h1 , h2 , h3 
{ }

Targets the <h1> , <h2> and <h3> element.

Class Selector

Match an element that have a class attribute with a value that match the one specific after the period or a full stop symbol.

.note 
{}

Target any element that have a class attribute and that attribute have a value note.

p.note
{}

Target only the paragraph element with the class attribute whose value is note.

ID Selector

Match an element that have a Id attribute with a value that match the one that specific after a hashtag or a pound symbol.

#introduction
{}

Target the element that have a ID attribute and that ID attribute whose value is introduction.

Child Selector

Match an element that is a direct child of another .

li > a {}

Target <a> element that sit inside the <li> element but all the <a> element in the page the <a> is style it must be sit inside the <li> element since it‚Äôs child selector . not even it‚Äôs nested it lot apply to <a> but not nested inside <a>

Descendant Selector

Match an element that is Descendant of another specific element ( Not only a directly of that element ) .

p a{}

Target any <a> element that sit inside the any <p> element the nested element would have apply too even it‚Äôs nested

Adjacent Sibling Selector

Match an element that is sibling of another 

h1+p{}

Target the First <p> element after the <h1> element ( but not the other <p> that sit inside ). this one must be preceding

General Sibling Selector

Match an element that is sibling of another. Although it do not have to be a directly preceding element. 

h1~p{}

If you have the two<p> or more element that are sibling to the <h1> the rule will be apply to both or more even it‚Äôs not the preceding element.

How CSS Rules Cascade

If There are two or more rule apply to the same element. It‚Äôs important to understand which one will take the precedence.

Last Rule

If there two selector are identical the latter of the two selector will take the precedence. In the example below you can see the second <i> element will take the precedence . Meaning that if we have.

h1
{
  color: red;
}
h1
{
  color: blue;
}
h1
{
  color: yellow;
}

The last h1{ color: yellow} will take the precedence over the first two.

Specificity

If one selector is more specific than other the more specific rule will take the precedence than the general one . For example

  • h1 is more specific than *
  • p b is more specific than p
  • p#intro is more specific than p

Important

You can add !important after the any value of the property to indicate that it should be consider more important than other rule that apply to the same element.

By Understanding how the CSS rule cascade mean you can write a simpler stylesheet because you can create a generic team that apply to most of the element and override the property on the individual element that need to appear differently on the page. 

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<h1> Potatos </h1>
	<p id = "intro"> There are <i> dozens </i> of different <b> potato </b> varities .</p>
	<p> They are usually described as early, second early and maincrop potatoes. </p>
</html>
*
{
  font-family: Arial;
}
h1
{
  font-family: monospace;
}
i
{
  color: green;
}
i
{ 
  color: red;
}
b
{
  color: pink;
}
p b
{
 color: blue !important;
}
p b
{
 color: violet;
}
p#intro
{
 font-size: 100%;
}
p
{
 font-size: 75%;
}

Inheritance

If you specify the font-family and the color property in the <body> element it will apply to the most child element . This is because the value of of this font-family property is inherit by the child element. It will save you from having apply property to as many of the element. and the result in the simpler stylesheet.

You can compare it with the background color and border property in the parent element . They are not inherit by the child element if they do inherit by all the child element these page could be quite messy.

You can force a lot of property to inherit value from their parent by using the inherit for the value of the element . in this example below their are <div> element with the class name page inherit padding size value from the CSS rule that apply to the body element.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<div class = "page">
			<h1> Potatoes </h1>
			<p> There are dozens of different potato varieties. </p>
			<p> They are usually described as early. second early and 
			maincrop potatoes. </p>
	<div>
	</body>
body
{
	font-family: Arial;
	color: #66544;
	padding: 10px;
}
.page
{
 broder: 1px solid #665544;
 background-color: #efefef;
 padding: inherit;
}

Why Use External Style Sheets?

When building a Website there are several advantage to placing your CSS rule in the separate stylesheet.

All your web page can share the same style sheet rule. This is achieve by using <link> element on each of the page on the site to link to that one CSS document. This mean that you no need to repeat each code in every HTML page. which result in less code and smaller HTML page.

Therefore when the users download the CSS stylesheet the entire site will load faster. And if you ever want to change how the site would appear you only need to edit that one CSS file and all the page will be updated. For example if you want to style how the <h1> element you only need to alter the one CSS stylesheet rather than changing each of the CSS rule on every page. The HTML code will be easier to read and edit because it doesn‚Äôt have a lot of CSS rule in the same document. It‚Äôs generally consider best practice to separate your content in your site from the rule that determine how the page is appear.

Some time you might consider placing the CSS rule as the same as HTML code.

If you create a single page you might decide put a CSS rule in the same file to keep everything in one place. ( However many author consider it‚Äôs best practice to keep the CSS rule in the separate file ) .

If you have a one page which required a few extra of rule that do not use by the entire site you can consider use the CSS rule in the same file . But ( again many author consider it‚Äôs the best practice to keep the CSS rule in the separate file ) .

Most of the example in the book place the CSS file in the <head> document using the <style> element. rather than the separate document and that because it saving you from opening 2 CSS file use to see how the example work.

Different Versions Of CSS And Browser Quirks

CSS1 was release in 1996 . CSS2 was release in 1998. Work on CSS3 is still ongoing but major browser have already start to implement this .

In the same way as HTML. There are several version of HTML and also there are several version of CSS.

Browser did not implement this all CSS feature at once. So older browser do not support every property. ( this paragraph mean that when ever the new CSS introduce the older browser that we are using need to wait for the update so that they fully support that new CSS otherwise the older browser can‚Äôt use or render the design correctly or not what you expected it to do when using the new CSS. ). Browser need to be update so they can fully support the new CSS so you can fully use it

This is mention here when it is likely to affect you. Along with the note of the CSS property that are not behave as expected.

Any seasoned user of CSS will tell you that some of the browser show/display some of the few CSS property in an unexpected way. But finding and squashing this bug is easy when you know how.

Before launching any site it‚Äôs important to check your site in more than one browser. Because these page can be slight different when the browser display the page.

You do not need a lot of computer to test your site as there are online tool that show your page look like in multiple browser :

  • BrowserCam.com
  • BrowserLab.Adobe.com
  • BrowserShot.org
  • CrossBrowserTesting.com

Using these tool it‚Äôs a good idea to test your site on different operating system ( MAC , Window , Linux ) or in order versions of Major browser as well as the recent version.

When you look at your site in more than one browser you might find that some element on your page do not look as you expected.

When CSS property display do not look as you expected it‚Äôs generally referring to CSS bugs or Browser Quirks.

Some common CSS bug or Browser Quirks are discuss in this book . But there are many of the smaller bug that occur in the rare situations or older browser that few user might use.

When you encounter some of this Browser Quirks or CSS bug you can use your favorite search engine to fine the solution or check this site :

  • PositionIsEverything.net
  • QuirksMode.org

SUMMARY CHAPTER TEN : Introducing CSS

CHAPTER ELEVEN : COLOR

Color can really being your page to life.

In this Chapter we will look at :

  • How to specify the color as well as there are three common way in which you can indicate your choice of color ( plus extra make available in CSS3 ) .
  • Color terminology as there are some term that are very helpful to understand when it come to picking color.
  • Contrast and ensuring your text is readable.
  • Background color for behind either for the entire page or the part of the page.

What you learn About color in this chapter then will be use in the next subsequent chapter when we start looking at color in the box and color in the text in CSS.

Foreground Color

color

The color property allow you to specify the color of the text inside an element. You can specify any color in CSS in these one of these three way :

RBG Values

These express the color in term of How much red , green and blue are use to make it up. For example:

rgb( 100 , 100 , 0 ).

Hex Codes

These are Six digit code that represent the amount of red , green and blue in color precede by Hashtag ( # ) or pound ( # ) symbol. For example : #ee3e80

Color Names

There are 147 predefined color name that recognize by the browser. For example : red.

We look at these three different way of specifying color on the next double page sheet.

In CSS3 introduce another way of specify color is known as HSLA which you will meet at the end of this chapter.

below each CSS rule in this example CSS allow you to add comment to your CSS file. Anything that sit between /* symbol and */ symbol will not interpreted by the browser and shown in gray below.

The use of the comment help you to understand a CSS file and organize it by splitting the long document in to a section Here below we use the comment to indicate which method is used to specify each of different type of color.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<link href = "example.css" type = "text/css" rel = "stylesheet">
	</head>
	<body>
		<h1> Marine Biology </h1>
		<h2> The Composition of Seawater </h2>
		<p> Almost anything can be found in seawater. This includes 
		    dissolved materials from Earth's crust as well as materials 
		    released from organisms. The most important components of 
		    seawater that influence life forms are salinity, temperature,
		    dissolved gases ( mostly oxygen and carbon dioxide ) , nutrients,
		    and pH. These elements vary in their composition as well as 
		    in their influence on marine life. </p>
		</body>
	</html>
h1
{
  /* rgb value */
  color: rgb(100 , 100 , 0);
}
h2
{
	/* hex codes */
	color: #ee3e80;
}
p
{
  /* color name */
  color: red;
}

Background Color

background-color

CSS treat each of the HTML element as if it‚Äôs appear in the box and the background-color property specify the color of the background for that box.

You can specify the choice of color in one of these three way the same as you specify the foreground color : rgb values , hex codes , color name .

If you do not specify any of the back ground than that background is transparent.

By default Most browser window have white background. But browser user can set a background color for their window. so if you want to ensure that your window have a white background you can use the background-color property on the <body> element.

We have also use the padding property to separate the text from the edge of the box to make it easier to read and you will learn this padding property in the further chapter.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<link href = "example.css" type = "text/css" rel = "stylesheet">
	</head>
	<body>
		<h1> Marine Biology </h1>
		<h2> The Composition of Seawater </h2>
		<p> Almost anything can be found in seawater. This includes dissolved
		    materials from Earth's crust as well as materials released from
		    organisms. The most important components of seawater that influence 
		    life forms are salinity, temperature, dissolved gases ( mostly
		    oxygen and carbon dioxide) , nutrients, and pH. These elements
		    vary in their composition as well as in their influence on
		    marine life. </p>
		  </body>
		 </head>
body
{
 background-color: rgb(100 , 100, 90);
}
h1
{
 background-color: #ee3e80;
}
h2
{
 background-color: red;
}
p
{
 background-color: white;
}

Understanding Color

Every color on a computer screen is create by mixing amount of red , green and blue. To find the color that you want you can use a color picker.

Computer monitor are made up of a thousand of tiny square known as pixel. If you look closely at a Monitor screen you will be able to see them.

When the screen is not turn on it‚Äôs black because it‚Äôs not emitting any light. But when the screen is on each of the pixels can be different color creating a picture.

The color of every pixel on the screen express in term of mixing red , green , blue just like on a television screen.

Color picking tool are available in a images editing program like photoshop and GIMP You can see the RGB value specify next to the radio button that say R ,G, B.

The Hex value is provide next to the pound and hashtag ( # ) symbol. There is also a good color picking tool at

  • colorschemedesigner.com

RGB values

Value for red , green and blue are express as a number between 0 and 255. rgb ( 102 , 205 ,170 )

This color is made up of following value:

102 red

205 green

170 blue

Hex Codes

Hex values are represent for values red , green and blue in Hexadecimal Code.

#66cdaa

The value of red 102 is expressed as 66 in hexadecimal code. The 205 of the green is expressed as cd in hexadecimal code and the 170 of the blue is express as a aa in hexadecimal code.

Color Names

Color are represent by a predefined name. However there are very limited in number.

MediumAquaMarine

There are 147 color name supported by browsers ( this color is MediumAquaMarine ) .

Most consider this to be a limited color palette and it‚Äôs hard to remember the name for each of the color so ( apart from white and black ) they are not commonly used .

Hue

Hue is near to a colloquial idea of color. Technically speaking however The color can also have a saturation and brightness as well as hue.

Saturation

Saturation refer to the amount of Gray in the color. At the maximum Saturation there is no gray in the color. At the minimum Saturation The color would be mostly gray.

Brightness

Brightness refer to how much black is in the color. At maximum brightness there is no black in the color. At minimum brightness the color would be very dark.

Contrast

When picking a Foreground color and a Background color it‚Äôs really important to ensure that there is enough contrast for the text to be legible .

Text is harder to read when there is low contrast between the Foreground color and Background color.

A lack of contrast is particularly problem for those who have a vision impairment and color blindness .

It‚Äôs also affect those who have poor monitor and sunlight on their screen ( which increasingly common as people start using handheld device outdoor ) .

Text is easier to read when there is higher contrast between the Foreground color and Background color.

If you want people to read a lot of text on your page. However too much contract can make it harder to read.

For a long span of text reduce your contrast a little bit can improve readability.

You can reduce a contrast by using the a dark gray text on a white back ground or a off white text on a dark background.

CSS3 Opacity

opacity

CSS3 introduce a opacity property that allow you to specify the opacity to any of an element. and any of its child element. A value of this property is a number between 0 and 1 meaning that 0.5 is 50% opacity and 0.15 is 15% opacity.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XTHML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<style type = "text/css">
			.box
			{
				color: #FFFFFF;
			  background-color: rgb(100 , 100 , 100); /* playrole as a fellback ( discuss below )
			  and also specify background color to change the capacity */
			  opacity: 0.5%; /* meanin that the background is 50% opacity */
			}
		</style>
	  <body>
		  <div class = "box">
			  <p> hello </p>
			</div>
		</body>
	</html>

rgba

CSS3 introduce rgba property that allow you to specify color just like you would specify color in the rgb value but with a extra one value that indicate the opacity. This value is known as a alpha value and is number value between 0 and 1 meaning that 0.5 is 50% opacity and 0.15 is 15% opacity. This rgba property is only affect the element which it is applied to ( not a child element ).

Because some browser do not recognize a rgba color you can offer a fallback so that it will display a solid back ground color. If there are two rule applied to the same element the latter of the two will take the priority. To create a fallback you can specify your color as a hex code, rgb value, or a color name follow by the rgba value ( meaning that if our browser cant display a rgba value which is blue we make it to display a solid blue follow by the rgba value we don‚Äôt want it to display green solid color if our rgba is blue ) If your browser do support rgba value it will follow that rgba rule . and if it does not support rgba it will follow the rgb solid color rule.

At the time writing this the opacity and the rgba only support in the recent browser.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<style>
			.box
			{
				color: #FFFFFF;
				background-color: rgb(100 ,100 ,0); /* Act like a fellback for the rgba if the browser 
				do not support must follow the rgba value */
				
				background-color: rgba(100, 100, 0, 0.5); /* 50% opacity for that background */ 
			}
		</style>
		<body>
			<div class = "box">
				<p> HI </p>
			</div>
		</body>
	</html>

CSS3 : HSL Colors

CSS3 introduces an entire new and intuitive way to specify color using the Hue , Saturation and Lightness value.

Hue

Hue is the colloquial idea of the color. In HSL Hue often represent as a color circle where the angle represent the color. Although it may be shown as slider with a value from 0 and 360 degree.

Saturation

Saturation is the amount of gray in the color. Saturation is represent as a percentage. 100% is a full saturation meaning that there is no gray in the color 0% mean that the color is shade of gray.

Lightness

Lightness is the amount of white or black in the color. Lightness is represent as a percentage. 100% lightness is white mean that the color is white . 0% lightness is black mean that the color is black . 50% lightness is normal mean that our color is balance.

Please note that the lightness is a different concept to the brightness Graphic design software such as photoshop and GIMP have a color picker that use Hue , Saturation and Brightness but Brightness only add black. Whereas lightness offer both black and white.

CSS3: HSL & HSLA

hsl

The hsla color property has been introduces in CSS3 as the alternative way to specify color. The value of that property start with the hsla follow by each individual value inside the parenthesis for :

hue

This express as a angle ( since angle represent the color ) between 0 and 360 degrees.

saturation

This express as a percentages ( 0% mean the color is shade of gray , 100% there is no gray in the color ) .

lightness

This express as a percentages ( 100% color being white , 0% color being black , 50% color being normal ).

hsla

The hsla property color allow you to specify the color using the hue , saturation and lightness just like a hsl but add fourth value which represent as a transparency ( just like a rgba ) and the a stand for

alpha

This express in number between 0 and 1 meaning that 0.10 is 10% transparency 0.5 mean that 50% transparency.

Because some older browser do not recognize hsl or hsla value it‚Äôs a good idea to add extra rule that specify color using the hex code , rgb value or a color name. The use of this must appear before the hsl or a hsla value. This provide a fallback . In CSS if two rule applied to the same element the latter of the two will take the priority. So it mean that if the browser do understand the hsl or hsla value it will use it otherwise it will use the first rule which is the one you specify the color using the hex , rgb value or a color name.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<body>
		<h1> Marine Biology </h1>
		<h2> The Composition of Seawater </h2>
		<p>  Almost anything can be found in seawater. This includes
		     dissolved materials from Earth's crust as well as materials
		     released from organisms. The most important components of sea
		     water that influence life forms are salinity temperature.
		     dissolved gases ( mostly oxygen and carbon dioxide). nutrients
		     and pH. These elements vary in their composition as well as in their 
		     influence on marine life. </p>
	</body>
</html>
body
{
  hsla( 360, 10%, 15%, 1);
}
h1
{
  hsla( 125, 100%, 33%, 1);
}
h2
{
  hsla( 315, 100%, 55%, 1);
}
p
{
  hsla( 31, 100%, 83%, 0.7);
}

Example Color

This example shows a pH scale to demonstrate the different ways that colors can be specified using CSS ( using color names, hex codes , RGB value ) .

The rule for the <body> element sets a default color for all the text as well as the default background color for the page. Both use color name.

The rule for the <h1> element sets the color of the heading using a hex code. There are two values for background-color property of the <h1> element. The First provides a fallback color using a hex code and the second is an HSLA value for browsers that support this method.

Each paragraph is then shown in a different color to represent the varying levels of acidity or alkalinity, and these are specified using RGB values.

The example also uses a property called margin to decrease the gap between the paragraph boxes, and the property called padding to create a gap between the edge of the boxes and the text within them. ( These property cover in the further chapter ).

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head><title> pH Scale </title>
	<link href = "example.css"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"/></head>
  <body>
	  <h1> pH scale </h1>
	  <p id = "ph14"> 14.0 VERY ALKALINE </p>
	  <p id = "ph13"> 13.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph12"> 12.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph11"> 11.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph10"> 10.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph09">  9.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph08">  8.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph07">  7.0 NEUTRAL </p>
	  <p id = "ph06">  6.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph05">  5.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph04">  4.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph03">  3.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph02">  2.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph01">  1.0 </p>
	  <p id = "ph00">  0.0 VERY ACID </p>
	</body>
</html>
	  
body 
{
	background-color: #cad3d2;
}
body h1
{
  background-color: #acd3ec;
  background-color: hsla(203 , 62% , 80% , 1);
}
#ph14
{
 background-color: rgb(0 , 84, 153);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 100% , 30%);
}
#ph13
{
 background-color: rgb(10 , 111 ,194);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 90% , 40%);
}
#ph12
{
 background-color: rgb(25 , 138 , 230);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 80% , 50%);
}
#ph11
{
 background-color: rgb(82 , 160 ,224);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 70% , 60%);
}
#ph10
{
 background-color: rgb(133 , 183 , 224);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 60% , 70%);
}
#ph09
{
 background-color: rgb(179 , 207 , 230);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 50% , 80%);
}
#ph08
{
 background-color: rgb(219 , 231 , 240);
 background-color: hsl(207 , 40% , 90%);
}
#ph07
{
 background-color: rgb(0 , 255 , 0);
 background-color: hsl(120 , 100% , 50%);
}
#ph06
{
 background-color: rgb(240 , 219 , 238);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 40% , 90%);
}
#ph05
{
 background-color: rgb(230 , 179 , 224);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 50% , 80%);
}
#ph04
{
 background-color: rgb(224 , 133 , 215);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 60% , 70%);
}
#ph03
{
 background-color: rgb(224 , 82 , 210);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 70% , 60%);
}
#ph02
{
 background-color: rgb(230 , 26 , 209);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 80% , 50%);
}
#ph01
{
 background-color: rgb(194 , 10 ,175);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 90% , 40%);
}
#ph00
{
 background-color: rgb(153 , 0 , 138);
 background-color: hsl(306 , 100% , 30%);
}

SUMMARY CHAPTER ELEVEN : Color

CHAPTER TWELVE : TEXT

The property that allow you to control the appearence of text can be split in to two groups :

  • Those that would directly affect the font and its appearence ( also including the typeface whether it‚Äôs a regular or both or a italic ) and the size of the text.
  • Those that would have the same effect on the text no matter what the font that are using ( including the color of the font and the space between the words and letter ) .

The formatting of the text can have a significant effect on how readable your page . As we go thought each property author writing this book will give us some tip how to display the type.

Typeface Terminology

Serif

Serif font have an extra detail on the end of the main strokes of the letter. These details known as Serif.

Sans-Serif

Sans-Serif font have a straight end to letter and therefore have a much cleaner design.

Monospace

Every letter in the Monospace ( or fix width ) fonts is the same width ( there is no monospace have a different width ) .

In print Serif font were traditionally use for the long passage of text because they were consider easier to read.

Screen is lower resolution than print. So if the text is small San-serif can be the clever way to read.

Monospace are commonly use for code because they align nicely that make the text easier to follow.

Weight

The fonts weight not only it add emphasis it can also affect the amount of space and contrast on the page.

Style

Italics font have a cursive aspect on some lettering. Oblique font style take a normal font style and put it on the angle.

Stretch

In condensed ( or narrow ) version of the font letter can be closer and thinner together . In the expand version of the font the letter can be further and thicker apart .

Choosing A Typeface For A Website

When choosing a typeface it‚Äôs important to understand that browser only display it if it‚Äôs install on that users computer.

Serif

Serif font have add extra detail on the end of the main stroke of the letter.

Sans-Serif

Sans-serif font have the straight end to letter and therefore have much cleaner design.

Monospace

Every letter in the Monospace font is the same width and no Monospace font can have a different width.

Cursive

Cursive fonts are either have joining stroke or have a other cursive characteristic such as handwriting style.

Fantasy

Fantasy fonts are usually a decorative font that often use for a title. This fantasy are not design for a long body of text.

As result site often use the small set of typeface that are already install on most of the computer show above in the example.

It‚Äôs possible to specify more than one typeface and create a order of preference ( just in case the user does not have the first choice of typeface install ) .

Browser are suppose to support at least one of these typeface ( shown in the example ) from each of the group above ( sharif , sans-sharif , monospace , cursive , fantasy ) . For this reason it‚Äôs common add generic font name ( sharif , sans-sharif , monospace , cursive , fantasy ) after the preferred choice of typeface ( shown in the example of each group ) .

For example : if you want to specify sharif generic font type you could write following :

font-family: Georgia , Times , sherif; /* sherif is the generic font type */

Techniques That Offer A Wider Choice Of Typefaces

There are several way to use the font other than the list on the previous page. However these typeface are subject to copyright so the technique that you choose from are limited by their respective licenses.

Font Family

The users computer need to install the typeface . CSS allow you to specify the typeface.

Issues : There is a limited choice of typeface that most user have install. ( meaning that we rely on users need to install the font on our webpage to see the font on the page as we expect otherwise fallback font will occur ) .

Licensing : You are not distributing the typeface so these is no Licensing need.

Choice of Typeface : There is a limited choice because the font need to be install in the users computer.

Font Face

CSS allow you to specify where the font is download when it‚Äôs not install on the users computer.

Issues : The users need to download the font file which can slow down loading on the web page.

Licensing : The license must permit its distributing using the #font-face . ( since we are provide the font to the users we must need to ensure that our font that we provide to the users is legal have a license something like that )

Choice of Typeface : Choice is limited because few typeface can be freely distribute this way. ( since some font are come with no license and free meaning that we provide it to the user without worrying but most of the font are license we need to paid and not free provide it to the users without license or paid meaning that we are against the law ) .

Service Base Font Face

The commercial service give users access to wider range of font using @font-face.

Issues : There is a ongoing fee to cover license paid to the font foundries.

Licensing : The Services take care of the licensing issues with the people who create them.

Choice of Typeface : Each service offer different choice of font base on their agreements with font foundries.

If you design on Mac it‚Äôs really important to check the typeface on PC because PC can render the type less smoothly. If you design on PC it will look fine on mac

Images

You can create a graphic that contain the text that you want it to appear in different typeface.

Issues : users that use the screen reader will rely on the alt text to know what it said

Licensing : You can use any typeface you want if you have a license to use on the computer ( you are not distributing the typeface ) .

Choice Of Typeface : Very wide choice because you can use any typeface that you have a license for.

SIFR

The font is embedded into a Flash movie, and JavaScript replaces specified HTML text with flash version of it.

Issues : This method only works if the user has Flash and JavaScript enabled on their device.

Licensing : Many commercial makers of typefaces allow this technique, although you may need to pay for an extra web-use license.

Choice of Typefaces : This method provides a lot of choice because many of the major typeface manufacturers permit this kind of usage.

Cufon

Cufon offers similar functionality to SIFR. it uses JavaScript to create either an SVG or VML version of the text.

Issues : Requires JavaScript to be enabled. Also users cannot select text, and text can‚Äôt change when a user hover over it.

Licensing : As with sIFR, some typeface makers allow use of their fonts with CUFON, but you need to check the license.

Choice of Typefaces : Slightly less choice than for sIFR, as some typeface manufacturers are not as keen on this technique.

Specifying Typeface

font-family

The font family property allow you to specify a typeface that should be use for any text inside the elements to which CSS rule applied to.

The value of this property is the name of the typeface that you want to use.

The people who are visiting your site need the typeface that you specify to be install on their computer in order for it to be display.

You can specify a list of font separate by comma so that if the users does not have the first choice of font install browser will try to look at the alternative font from the list.

It‚Äôs common to end with the generic font name of that type.

If the font name made up more than one word it should be put inside the double quote.

Designer suggest that the page would look better if they are no more than three typeface on the page.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XTHML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
	<html>
		<head>
			<link href = "exmaple.css"
						rel  = "stylesheet"
						type = "text/css"/> </head>
		<body>
			<h1> Briards </h1>
			<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
			<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard, </a> or berger de brie,
			is a large breed of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep. </p>
			<h1> Breed History </h1>
			<p> The briard, which is believed to have originated in France, has been 
			bred for centuries to herd and to protect sheep. The breed was used by the French
			Army as sentries, messengers and to search for wounded soldiers becuase of its fine sense
			of hearing . Briards were used in the First World War almost to the point of extinction.
			Currently the population of briards is slowly recovering. Charlemagne, Napoleon, Thosmas
			Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards. </p> 
		</body> 
	</html>
			
body
{
	font-family: Georgia , Times ,serif;
}
h1 
{
 font-family: Arial , Verdana ,sans-serif;
}
h2
{
 font-family: "Courier New" , monospace;
}

Size Of Type

font-size

The font-size property allow you to specify the size for the font. There are several that allow you to specify the size for fonts . Here are commonly use :

Pixels

Pixels are commonly use because they allow the web designer very precise control over how much space their text should take up. The number of the pixels follow by letter px.

Percentages

The default size of text in the browser is 16px. So the size 75% is equivalent to 12px and the size 200% would be 32px.

If you specify the rule that indicate all the text inside the <body> element to be 75% of default which is 12px and you specify another rule for the content that sit between the element inside the <body> element to be 75% that content that sit between the element should be 9px since ( 75% of 12px ).

Ems

em is equivalent to the width of letter m.

We will look at the measurement in the greater detail on the next page.

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"https://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html>
	<head>
		<link href = "exmaple.css"
					rel  = "stylesheet"
					type = "text/css"/>
	</head>
	<body>
		<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently the population of briards is
		slowly recovering Charlemagne, Napoleon, 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
	</body>
</html>
p
{
	font-family: Georgia , Times , serif;
	font-size: 1.3em;
}
h2
{
 font-family: "Courier New" , monospace;
 font-size: 16px;
}
h1
{
 font-family: Arial , Verdana , sans-serif;
 font-size: 200%;
}

Type Scales

You may have notices that some program such Word , Photoshop and InDesign offer the same size of text.

This is because they are set according to the scale or radio that was developed by European typographer in the sixteen centuries.

It‚Äôs consider that the scale for type is pleasing to the eye and it has therefore change the little in the last 400 years.

For this reason when design the page using size of this scale will help them look more attractive.

On the next page you can see how to achieve this scale using percentages , pixel and ems.

Print designer often refer to the size of text in term of point rather than pixel ( hence the use of pt in the scale on above ). A pixel is roughly equates to a point because a point is correspond to 1 / 72 of an inch. and most computer display have a resolution of 72 dot per inches. So this statement mean that if we encounter print designer writing a page they usually use a print ( pt ) rather than a pixel and in the most computer that display resolution of 72 dot per inches mean that 10pt = 10px if it display in other computer with different resolution or 72dot per inches we need formula to convert to px since display in monitor is in px we need to know the size of the type.

The default size of the text in the browser is 16pixels. So that if you use the percentage or ems you calculate the size of the text you want base on the the default size of text is used in the browser. For example you could scale down to 12 pixels for body and copy scale it up to 24 pixel for head. ( we need to calculator because the percentage and ems are relative to their parent and the default size of the text if there is no parent size the default size of text in the browser do use
so let say we use 50% meaning that 50% of the Parent size ( since we do not specific of parent size default size used in this case which is 16 ) formula.

and ems is relative to the parent size meaning that 1ems = parent size since we do not specific any parent size default size will use in this case so parent size = 16pixel
1ems = 16pixel formula:

Recently some Web designer have start to leave the body of text at the default size of 16 pixels and adjust other font size using the scale that keep the relative proportions of this one. ( this statement mean that Some Web designer often leave the body of text at the default size of 16pixel and adjusting other font size inside that body <element> using the scale which is ( relative unit such as percentage , ems , rem ) that keep the relative proportion of this one meaning that the body default size of text remain the same 16pixel but the other element can be larger than that and using the scale to keep the relative proportion mean that the scale that we use is rely on the its parent element and the root. For example the website show on the browser in the phone <body> element default size is 10px the <head> element we set is 5px and other element is 5px also display it on the PC that heading and other element remain 5px is so small on pc .

but using the scale mean that if the <body> element on the phone is 10px the <head> element we set is 50% rely on the parent and other element is 50% also rely on the <body> element of that phone. Display it on the PC it mean that 50% of the PC <body> element so if the PC element <body> element is 100px the <head> and other element is 50% of that 100px not remain the same 5px using the px.

When you first see the body text in 16 pixel it seem quite large . Once you get use to the larger type most people find it easier to read and going back to the page main type is 12pixels is often than look small.

Unit Of Type Size

Setting font size in pixels ensure that the type appear as you intent ( because percentage and ems are more likely to vary if that users have change the default size of text in their browser ) .

Pixels are relative to the resolution of the screen so the same type size will look larger when the screen has resolution of 800x600 than it would when 1280x800. meaning that if the pixel look larger when the screen is resolution 800x600 it might look smaller in the screen that have resolution 1280x800 it might look larger on Phone but not PC.

You can use the pt point size instead of the pixels. but you should only use this when create a stylesheet for a print friendly version of page.

The default size of the text in the browser is 16 pixel. Using the percentages of this amount you can create a scale where the default size is 12 pixel. And heading are sized relation to this.

It‚Äôs possible to allow users to change the default size of text on their browser if they do that the font will be display at the same scale just like designer indented but increasing the size of the font.

Ems allow you to change the size of text relative to the size of text in the parent element. By default size of text in most browser is 16pixel. So you can use similar rule to those shown for percentages.

Because users can change the browser default size of text on their browser. All the font can appear larger or smaller then the designer indented.

More Font Choice

@font-face

font-face allow you to use the fonts even if it‚Äôs not install on the computer of the users browsing. By allowing you to specify the path to the copy of the font. Which will be download when it‚Äôs not on the users machine.

Because of this technique you allow the version of the font to be download on the users computer. It‚Äôs really important that the license of the font is permit to use in this way.

You add the font to the style sheet using the font-face property ( as shown below ) .

it must contain a font-family property to specify the font name for that src from the internet

font-family

font-family allow you to specify the font name. And that font name ( that you have specify in the font-face ) then be used as the value of this font-family property in the rest of the stylesheet ( as shown in rule for <h1> and <h2> element ) .

src

Allow you to specify the path to the font in order for this technique to work in all browser you probably need to specify the path to a few different version of the fonts. ( shown on the next page )

format

Allow you to specify the format for the font that you supplied in ( shown on the next page ) .

Many typeface maker do not allow you to use the font this way but there are several open sources font that allow you to use it freely here you can find the list of them

  • www.fontsquirrel.com
  • www.fontex.org
  • www.openfontlibrary.org

When looking at the font on these website it‚Äôs still important to look at the font license agreement because some font only free on personal website or use ( but not for use on commercial website ) .

There are some site that give you access to the commercial fonts. Because they negotiated permission to let the customer use these fonts for fee.

  • www.typekit.com
  • www.kernest.com
  • www.fontspring.com

Google also provide a open source fonts. rather then adding the font-face on your own stylesheet . To link CSS file and the font file on their server :

www.google.com/webfonts

<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Yuji+Mai&display=swap" 
			 rel="stylesheet">
<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body>
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently the population of briards is
		slowly recovering Charlemagne, Napoleon, 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
@font-face 
{
 font-family: "customfont" /* so this customfont is the name of the src */
 src : url('font/Roboto.eot');
}
h1 , h2 
{
 font-family: customfont , san-sherif; /* meaning that the customfont is refer to the 
 roboto.eot from the internet that browser have download*/
}

Understanding Font Formats

Different browser support different font format ( in the same as music and video format ) So you need to supply the font in several variation to reach all the browser.

If you do not have all the format for the font you can upload the font in the website called FontSquirrel where it will convert it for you.

www.fontsquirrel.com

FontSquirrel also provide you a CSS code for the @font-face rule This is very help because when dealing with multiple format the src and format property of the @font-face rule can get rather complicated.

You will see an example more complicate @font-face rule in the example below.

The various font formats should appear in this order in your code:

  • eof
  • woff
  • ttf/otf
  • svg

Browser need to download the font-file in order to show. The user might see something known as Flash Unstyle Content (FUC) or Flash Unstyle Text ( FUT ) Two thing you can try to minimize this behaviour are you can delete the unnecessary glyphs from the font and host the font on Content Delivery Network ( the special web hosting site that offer faster delivery of file ) .

<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body>
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently the population of briards is
		slowly recovering Charlemagne, Napoleon, 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
@font-face 
{
 font-family: "customfont"
 src : url("font/roboto.eof") format("eof");
 src : url("font/roboto.woff") format("woff");
 src : url("font/roboto.ttf") format("truetype");
 src : url("font/roboto.svg") format("svg");
}
h1 , h2 
{
	font-family: cusomfont , sans-sherif;
}

So in order for this to work is you need to download the package it include all the format and save it in file location in our case is font folder location so when the user check our site the browser will go to that file location download the package base on the browser that support instead of the users need that font to be install on their phone

Bold

font-weight

font-weight property allow you to create a bold text. There are 2 value this property could take :

normal

This cause the text to appear at normal weight.

bold

This cause the text to appear bold.

The example below show that every element that have a class attribute and that attribute is credit will be appear in bold.

So you might wonder why it has a normal weight. This is because you want to create a rule that indicate all the element inside the <body> element should appear in bold but you might want to add the option that allow the text in certain instance to appear at the normal weight. This essentially just like a off switch .

<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body class = "credit">
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently the population of briards is
		slowly recovering Charlemagne, Napoleon, 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
.credit 
{
	font-weight: bold;
}
h1 , h2 
{
	font-weight: normal;
}

Italic

font-style

If you want to create a italic font you can use the font-style property. There are 3 value this property can take :

normal

This cause the text to appear at normal ( oppose to italics and oblique ) .

italics

This cause the text to appear at italics.

Oblique

this cause the text to appear Oblique.

In this example every element that have a class attribute and the value of that attribute is credit will be appear at italics.

Italics were traditionally stylish version of the font base on the Calligraphy. whereas Oblique version would take the normal version and put it on the angle.

It‚Äôs not unusual for the browser to fail to find the italics version of the typeface in which case it will use the algorithms and to place the normal version of type on slants which mean a lot of italics text online is actually just a oblique. 

<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body class = "credit">
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently the population of briards is
		slowly recovering Charlemagne, Napoleon, 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
.class 
{
	font-style: italics;
}
p
{
	font-style: normal;
}
h1 , h2
{
	font-style: oblique;
}

Uppercase And Lowercase

text-transform

The text-transform property allow you to change the case of the text This property can take this following value :

uppercase

This cause the text to appear in uppercase.

lowercase

This cause the text to appear in lowercase

capitalize

This cause the first letter of each word to appear in capitalize.

In this example <h1> element text will be appear in uppercase <h2> element text will appear in lowercase. And the element that have a class attribute whose value is credit will be appear in capitalize.

If you do utilize the uppercase option it‚Äôs worth looking at the letter-spacing property which allow you to increase the size between the gap of each letter. which shown on the future page. This will improve the readability.

<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body>
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently <span class = "credit"> the population of briards is
		slowly recovering charlemagne, napoleon, </span> 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
h1 
{
	text-tranform: uppercase;
}
h2
{
	text-tranform: lowercase;
}
.credit 
{
	text-tranform: capitalize;
}

Underline And Strike

text-decoration

This text-decoration property can take this following property :

none

This remove all of the decoration that was applied to the text.

underline

This add the line underneath the text.

overline

This add the line over the top of the text.

line-though

This add the line through the word.

blink

These animate the text to make it flash on or off however it‚Äôs generally frown upon as it‚Äôs consider rather annoying.

In this example the <h1> element will be add line underneath the text , <h2> element will be add line over the top of the text <p> will be add the line-thought the text and the class the attribute whose value is credit will be set to blink and the <a> element will be set to none to set the decoration of this <a> element to a normal or default no decoration applied . since by default anything that sit between the <a> element will be appear in blue text and line underneath.

<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body>
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently <span class = "credit"> the population of briards is
		slowly recovering charlemagne, napoleon, </span> 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
h1 
{
	text-decoration: underline;
}
h2
{
	text-decoration: overline;
}
p 
{
	textt-decoration: line-though;
}
a 
{
	text-decoration: none;
}
.credit 
{
	text-decoration: blink;
}

This property is commonly use by the designer to remove the underline that browser place under link. On the future page you will see how to add and remove the line when user hover over the link.

Leading

line-height

Leading is the term typographer use for vertical space between the line of text. In typeface the part of letter beneath the baseline is called descender. While the top of the point of letter is call ascender. Leading measure from the bottom of the descender of that one line to the top of the ascender on the next.

In CSS line-height property allow you to set the height for the entire line of the text. different between the font size and the line-height is equivalent to the leading.

Increasing the line-height make the vertical grab between line of text larger.

Increasing the amount of default of leading make the text easier to read. This make the vertical space between the line of text is larger than the space between each word. as this make the eye move along the text instead of down. A good starting setting is to set it as 1.4 or 1.5 ems because users can adjust the default size of text in their browser. the value of this line-height property should be in ems not pixel so the gap is relative base on the size of the text users selected .

<html>
<head>
	<link href = "example.com"
				type = "text/css"
				rel  = "stylesheet"> </head> 
<body>
	<h1> Briards </h1>
		<h2> by Ivy Duckett </h2>
		<p> The <a href = "https://www.briard.com"> briard </a> or berger de brie , is a large breed 
		of dog traditionally used as a herder and guardian of sheep </p>
		<h1> Breed History </h1>
		<p> The briard which is believed to have originated in France, 
		has been bred for centuried
		to herdand to protect sheep. The breed was used by the 
		French Army as sentries, messengers
		and to search for wounded soldiers because of its 
		fine sense of hearing. Briards were used in 
		the First World War almost to the point of extinction. 
		Currently <span class = "credit"> the population of briards is
		slowly recovering charlemagne, napoleon, </span> 
		Thomas Jefferson and Lafayette all owned briards </p>
</body>
</html>
h1 + p {
	line-height: 1.4em };

Letter And Word Spacing

letter-spacing

Kerning is the term typographer use for the space between each letter. To control the space between the each letter you can use the letter-spacing property.
